text: Chapter 1
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am forced to admit that even though I had traveled a long distance to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: place Bowen Tyler's manuscript in the hands of his father, I was still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a trifle skeptical as to its sincerity, since I could not but recall
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it had not been many years since Bowen had been one of the most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: notorious practical jokers of his alma mater.  The truth was that as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sat in the Tyler library at Santa Monica I commenced to feel a trifle
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foolish and to wish that I had merely forwarded the manuscript by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: express instead of bearing it personally, for I confess that I do not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enjoy being laughed at.  I have a well-developed sense of humor--when
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the joke is not on me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mr. Tyler, Sr., was expected almost hourly.  The last steamer in from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Honolulu had brought information of the date of the expected sailing of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his yacht _Toreador_, which was now twenty-four hours overdue.  Mr.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tyler's assistant secretary, who had been left at home, assured me that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there was no doubt but that the _Toreador_ had sailed as promised, since
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he knew his employer well enough to be positive that nothing short of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an act of God would prevent his doing what he had planned to do.  I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: also aware of the fact that the sending apparatus of the _Toreador_'s
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wireless equipment was sealed, and that it would only be used in event
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of dire necessity.  There was, therefore, nothing to do but wait, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we waited.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We discussed the manuscript and hazarded guesses concerning it and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange events it narrated.  The torpedoing of the liner upon which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen J. Tyler, Jr., had taken passage for France to join the American
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ambulance was a well-known fact, and I had further substantiated by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wire to the New York office of the owners, that a Miss La Rue had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: booked for passage.  Further, neither she nor Bowen had been mentioned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among the list of survivors; nor had the body of either of them been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recovered.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Their rescue by the English tug was entirely probable; the capture of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the enemy _U-33_ by the tug's crew was not beyond the range of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibility; and their adventures during the perilous cruise which the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: treachery and deceit of Benson extended until they found themselves in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the waters of the far South Pacific with depleted stores and poisoned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water-casks, while bordering upon the fantastic, appeared logical
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enough as narrated, event by event, in the manuscript.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caprona has always been considered a more or less mythical land, though
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it is vouched for by an eminent navigator of the eighteenth century;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but Bowen's narrative made it seem very real, however many miles of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trackless ocean lay between us and it.  Yes, the narrative had us
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guessing.  We were agreed that it was most improbable; but neither of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us could say that anything which it contained was beyond the range of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibility.  The weird flora and fauna of Caspak were as possible
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: under the thick, warm atmospheric conditions of the super-heated crater
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as they were in the Mesozoic era under almost exactly similar
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conditions, which were then probably world-wide.  The assistant
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: secretary had heard of Caproni and his discoveries, but admitted that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he never had taken much stock in the one nor the other.  We were agreed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the one statement most difficult of explanation was that which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reported the entire absence of human young among the various tribes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with which Tyler had had intercourse.  This was the one irreconcilable
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: statement of the manuscript.  A world of adults!  It was impossible.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We speculated upon the probable fate of Bradley and his party of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: English sailors.  Tyler had found the graves of two of them; how many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more might have perished!  And Miss La Rue--could a young girl long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have survived the horrors of Caspak after having been separated from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all of her own kind?  The assistant secretary wondered if Nobs still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was with her, and then we both smiled at this tacit acceptance of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: truth of the whole uncanny tale:
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I suppose I'm a fool," remarked the assistant secretary; "but by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: George, I can't help believing it, and I can see that girl now, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the big Airedale at her side protecting her from the terrors of a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: million years ago.  I can visualize the entire scene--the apelike
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Grimaldi men huddled in their filthy caves; the huge pterodactyls
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soaring through the heavy air upon their bat-like wings; the mighty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dinosaurs moving their clumsy hulks beneath the dark shadows of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: preglacial forests--the dragons which we considered myths until science
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: taught us that they were the true recollections of the first man,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: handed down through countless ages by word of mouth from father to son
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out of the unrecorded dawn of humanity."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is stupendous--if true," I replied.  "And to think that possibly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they are still there--Tyler and Miss La Rue--surrounded by hideous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangers, and that possibly Bradley still lives, and some of his party!
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I can't help hoping all the time that Bowen and the girl have found the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: others; the last Bowen knew of them, there were six left, all told--the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mate Bradley, the engineer Olson, and Wilson, Whitely, Brady and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sinclair.  There might be some hope for them if they could join forces;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but separated, I'm afraid they couldn't last long."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If only they hadn't let the German prisoners capture the _U-33_!  Bowen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should have had better judgment than to have trusted them at all.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chances are von Schoenvorts succeeded in getting safely back to Kiel
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and is strutting around with an Iron Cross this very minute.  With a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large supply of oil from the wells they discovered in Caspak, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plenty of water and ample provisions, there is no reason why they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couldn't have negotiated the submerged tunnel beneath the barrier
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs and made good their escape."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I don't like 'em," said the assistant secretary; "but sometimes you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: got to hand it to 'em."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," I growled, "and there's nothing I'd enjoy more than _handing it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to them_!" And then the telephone-bell rang.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The assistant secretary answered, and as I watched him, I saw his jaw
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: drop and his face go white.  "My God!" he exclaimed as he hung up the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: receiver as one in a trance.  "It can't be!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What?" I asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Mr. Tyler is dead," he answered in a dull voice.  "He died at sea,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly, yesterday."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The next ten days were occupied in burying Mr. Bowen J. Tyler, Sr., and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arranging plans for the succor of his son.  Mr. Tom Billings, the late
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mr. Tyler's secretary, did it all.  He is force, energy, initiative and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: good judgment combined and personified.  I never have beheld a more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dynamic young man.  He handled lawyers, courts and executors as a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sculptor handles his modeling clay.  He formed, fashioned and forced
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them to his will.  He had been a classmate of Bowen Tyler at college,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and a fraternity brother, and before that he had been an impoverished
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and improvident cow-puncher on one of the great Tyler ranches.  Tyler,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sr., had picked him out of thousands of employees and made him; or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather Tyler had given him the opportunity, and then Billings had made
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: himself.  Tyler, Jr., as good a judge of men as his father, had taken
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him into his friendship, and between the two of them they had turned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out a man who would have died for a Tyler as quickly as he would have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for his flag.  Yet there was none of the sycophant or fawner in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Billings; ordinarily I do not wax enthusiastic about men, but this man
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Billings comes as close to my conception of what a regular man should
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be as any I have ever met.  I venture to say that before Bowen J. Tyler
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sent him to college he had never heard the word _ethics_, and yet I am
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equally sure that in all his life he never has transgressed a single
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tenet of the code of ethics of an American gentleman.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ten days after they brought Mr. Tyler's body off the _Toreador_, we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steamed out into the Pacific in search of Caprona.  There were forty in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the party, including the master and crew of the _Toreador_; and Billings
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the indomitable was in command.  We had a long and uninteresting search
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for Caprona, for the old map upon which the assistant secretary had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally located it was most inaccurate.  When its grim walls finally
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rose out of the ocean's mists before us, we were so far south that it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a question as to whether we were in the South Pacific or the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Antarctic.  Bergs were numerous, and it was very cold.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All during the trip Billings had steadfastly evaded questions as to how
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were to enter Caspak after we had found Caprona.  Bowen Tyler's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manuscript had made it perfectly evident to all that the subterranean
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outlet of the Caspakian River was the only means of ingress or egress
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the crater world beyond the impregnable cliffs.  Tyler's party had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been able to navigate this channel because their craft had been a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: submarine; but the _Toreador_ could as easily have flown over the cliffs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as sailed under them.  Jimmy Hollis and Colin Short whiled away many an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hour inventing schemes for surmounting the obstacle presented by the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barrier cliffs, and making ridiculous wagers as to which one Tom
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Billings had in mind; but immediately we were all assured that we had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raised Caprona, Billings called us together.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There was no use in talking about these things," he said, "until we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found the island.  At best it can be but conjecture on our part until
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we have been able to scrutinize the coast closely.  Each of us has
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formed a mental picture of the Capronian seacoast from Bowen's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manuscript, and it is not likely that any two of these pictures
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: resemble each other, or that any of them resemble the coast as we shall
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently find it.  I have in view three plans for scaling the cliffs,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the means for carrying out each is in the hold.  There is an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: electric drill with plenty of waterproof cable to reach from the ship's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dynamos to the cliff-top when the _Toreador_ is anchored at a safe
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distance from shore, and there is sufficient half-inch iron rod to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: build a ladder from the base to the top of the cliff.  It would be a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long, arduous and dangerous work to bore the holes and insert the rungs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the ladder from the bottom upward; yet it can be done.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I also have a life-saving mortar with which we might be able to throw
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a line over the summit of the cliffs; but this plan would necessitate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of us climbing to the top with the chances more than even that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: line would cut at the summit, or the hooks at the upper end would slip.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "My third plan seems to me the most feasible.  You all saw a number of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large, heavy boxes lowered into the hold before we sailed.  I know you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did, because you asked me what they contained and commented upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large letter 'H' which was painted upon each box.  These boxes contain
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the various parts of a hydro-aeroplane.  I purpose assembling this upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the strip of beach described in Bowen's manuscript--the beach where he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found the dead body of the apelike man--provided there is sufficient
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: space above high water; otherwise we shall have to assemble it on deck
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and lower it over the side.  After it is assembled, I shall carry
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tackle and ropes to the cliff-top, and then it will be comparatively
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simple to hoist the search-party and its supplies in safety.  Or I can
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: make a sufficient number of trips to land the entire party in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: valley beyond the barrier; all will depend, of course, upon what my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first reconnaissance reveals."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That afternoon we steamed slowly along the face of Caprona's towering
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barrier.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You see now," remarked Billings as we craned our necks to scan the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: summit thousands of feet above us, "how futile it would have been to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: waste our time in working out details of a plan to surmount those." And
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he jerked his thumb toward the cliffs.  "It would take weeks, possibly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: months, to construct a ladder to the top.  I had no conception of their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formidable height.  Our mortar would not carry a line halfway to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crest of the lowest point.  There is no use discussing any plan other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than the hydro-aeroplane.  We'll find the beach and get busy."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Late the following morning the lookout announced that he could discern
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surf about a mile ahead; and as we approached, we all saw the line of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breakers broken by a long sweep of rolling surf upon a narrow beach.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The launch was lowered, and five of us made a landing, getting a good
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ducking in the ice-cold waters in the doing of it; but we were rewarded
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by the finding of the clean-picked bones of what might have been the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skeleton of a high order of ape or a very low order of man, lying close
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the base of the cliff.  Billings was satisfied, as were the rest of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us, that this was the beach mentioned by Bowen, and we further found
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that there was ample room to assemble the sea-plane.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Billings, having arrived at a decision, lost no time in acting, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the result that before mid-afternoon we had landed all the large boxes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: marked "H" upon the beach, and were busily engaged in opening them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Two days later the plane was assembled and tuned.  We loaded tackles
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ropes, water, food and ammunition in it, and then we each implored
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Billings to let us be the one to accompany him.  But he would take no
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one.  That was Billings; if there was any especially difficult or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangerous work to be done, that one man could do, Billings always did
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it himself.  If he needed assistance, he  never  called  for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: volunteers--just selected the man or men he considered best qualified
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the duty.  He said that he considered the principles underlying all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: volunteer service fundamentally wrong, and that it seemed to him that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: calling for volunteers reflected upon the courage and loyalty of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire command.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We rolled the plane down to the water's edge, and Billings mounted the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pilot's seat.  There was a moment's delay as he assured himself that he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had everything necessary.  Jimmy Hollis went over his armament and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition to see that nothing had been omitted.  Besides pistol and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifle, there was the machine-gun mounted in front of him on the plane,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ammunition for all three.  Bowen's account of the terrors of Caspak
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had impressed us all with the necessity for proper means of defense.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last all was ready.  The motor was started, and we pushed the plane
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out into the surf.  A moment later, and she was skimming seaward.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Gently she rose from the surface of the water, executed a wide spiral
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as she mounted rapidly, circled once far above us and then disappeared
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over the crest of the cliffs.  We all stood silent and expectant, our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes glued upon the towering summit above us.  Hollis, who was now in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: command, consulted his wrist-watch at frequent intervals.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Gad," exclaimed Short, "we ought to be hearing from him pretty soon!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hollis laughed nervously.  "He's been gone only ten minutes," he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: announced.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Seems like an hour," snapped Short.  "What's that?  Did you hear that?
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He's firing!  It's the machine-gun!  Oh, Lord; and here we are as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: helpless as a lot of old ladies ten thousand miles away!  We can't do a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thing.  We don't know what's happening.  Why didn't he let one of us go
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with him?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Yes, it was the machine-gun.  We would hear it distinctly for at least
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a minute.  Then came silence.  That was two weeks ago.  We have had no
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sign nor signal from Tom Billings since.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 2
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I'll never forget my first impressions of Caspak as I circled in, high
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over the surrounding cliffs.  From the plane I looked down through a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mist upon the blurred landscape beneath me.  The hot, humid atmosphere
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Caspak condenses as it is fanned by the cold Antarctic air-currents
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which sweep across the crater's top, sending a tenuous ribbon of vapor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far out across the Pacific.  Through this the picture gave one the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suggestion of a colossal impressionistic canvas in greens and browns
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and scarlets and yellows surrounding the deep blue of the inland
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sea--just blobs of color taking form through the tumbling mist.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I dived close to the cliffs and skirted them for several miles without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finding the least indication of a suitable landing-place; and then I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: swung back at a lower level, looking for a clearing close to the bottom
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the mighty escarpment; but I could find none of sufficient area to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: insure safety.  I was flying pretty low by this time, not only looking
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for landing places but watching the myriad life beneath me.  I was down
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pretty well toward the south end of the island, where an arm of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lake reaches far inland, and I could see the surface of the water
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: literally black with creatures of some sort.  I was too far up to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recognize individuals, but the general impression was of a vast army of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: amphibious monsters.  The land was almost equally alive with crawling,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaping, running, flying things.  It was one of the latter which nearly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did for me while my attention was fixed upon the weird scene below.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The first intimation I had of it was the sudden blotting out of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sunlight from above, and as I glanced quickly up, I saw a most terrific
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature swooping down upon me.  It must have been fully eighty feet
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long from the end of its long, hideous beak to the tip of its thick,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: short tail, with an equal spread of wings.  It was coming straight for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me and hissing frightfully--I could hear it above the whir of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: propeller.  It was coming straight down toward the muzzle of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: machine-gun and I let it have it right in the breast; but still it came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for me, so that I had to dive and turn, though I was dangerously close
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to earth.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The thing didn't miss me by a dozen feet, and when I rose, it wheeled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and followed me, but only to the cooler air close to the level of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff-tops; there it turned again and dropped.  Something--man's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: natural love of battle and the chase, I presume--impelled me to pursue
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it, and so I too circled and dived.  The moment I came down into the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warm atmosphere of Caspak, the creature came for me again, rising above
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me so that it might swoop down upon me.  Nothing could better have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suited my armament, since my machine-gun was pointed upward at an angle
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of about 45 degrees  and could not be either depressed or elevated by the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pilot.  If I had brought someone along with me, we could have raked the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great reptile from almost any position, but as the creature's mode of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attack was always from above, he always found me ready with a hail of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bullets.  The battle must have lasted a minute or more before the thing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly turned completely over in the air and fell to the ground.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen and I roomed together at college, and I learned a lot from him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outside my regular course.  He was a pretty good scholar despite his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: love of fun, and his particular hobby was paleontology.  He used to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tell me about the various forms of animal and vegetable life which had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: covered the globe during former eras, and so I was pretty well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: acquainted with the fishes, amphibians, reptiles, and mammals of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paleolithic times.  I knew that the thing that had attacked me was some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sort of pterodactyl which should have been extinct millions of years
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ago.  It was all that I needed to realize that Bowen had exaggerated
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing in his manuscript.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Having disposed of my first foe, I set myself once more to search for a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: landing-place near to the base of the cliffs beyond which my party
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: awaited me.  I knew how anxious they would be for word from me, and I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was equally anxious to relieve their minds and also to get them and our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supplies well within Caspak, so that we might set off about our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: business of finding and rescuing Bowen Tyler; but the pterodactyl's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carcass had scarcely fallen before I was surrounded by at least a dozen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the hideous things, some large, some small, but all bent upon my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: destruction.  I could not cope with them all, and so I rose rapidly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from among them to the cooler strata wherein they dared not follow; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then I recalled that Bowen's narrative distinctly indicated that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: farther north one traveled in Caspak, the fewer were the terrible
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptiles which rendered human life impossible at the southern end of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the island.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There seemed nothing now but to search out a more northerly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: landing-place and then return to the _Toreador_ and transport my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: companions, two by two, over the cliffs and deposit them at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rendezvous.  As I flew north, the temptation to explore overcame me.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knew that I could easily cover Caspak and return to the beach with less
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: petrol than I had in my tanks; and there was the hope, too, that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might find Bowen or some of his party.  The broad expanse of the inland
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sea lured me out over its waters, and as I crossed, I saw at either
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extremity of the great body of water an island--one to the south and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one to the north; but I did not alter my course to examine either
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closely, leaving that to a later time.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The further shore of the sea revealed a much narrower strip of land
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: between the cliffs and the water than upon the western side; but it was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a hillier and more open country.  There were splendid landing-places,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and in the distance, toward the north, I thought I descried a village;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but of that I was not positive.  However, as I approached the land, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw a number of human figures apparently pursuing one who fled across a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broad expanse of meadow.  As I dropped lower to have a better look at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these people, they caught the whirring of my propellers and looked
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aloft.  They paused an instant--pursuers and pursued; and then they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broke and raced for the shelter of the nearest wood.  Almost
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instantaneously a huge bulk swooped down upon me, and as I looked up, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized that there were flying reptiles even in this part of Caspak.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The creature dived for my right wing so quickly that nothing but a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sheer drop could have saved me.  I was already close to the ground, so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that my maneuver was extremely dangerous; but I was in a fair way of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: making it successfully when I saw that I was too closely approaching a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: large tree.  My effort to dodge the tree and the pterodactyl at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same time resulted disastrously.  One wing touched an upper branch; the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plane tipped and swung around, and then, out of control, dashed into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the branches of the tree, where it came to rest, battered and torn,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forty feet above the ground.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hissing loudly, the huge reptile swept close above the tree in which my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plane had lodged, circled twice over me and then flapped away toward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the south.  As I guessed then and was to learn later, forests are the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surest sanctuary from these hideous creatures, which, with their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enormous spread of wing and their great weight, are as much out of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: place among trees as is a seaplane.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a minute or so I clung there to my battered flyer, now useless
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond redemption, my brain numbed by the frightful catastrophe that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had befallen me.  All my plans for the succor of Bowen and Miss La Rue
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had depended upon this craft, and in a few brief minutes my own selfish
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: love of adventure had wrecked their hopes and mine.  And what effect it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might have upon the future of the balance of the rescuing expedition I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not even guess.  Their lives, too, might be sacrificed to my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suicidal foolishness.  That I was doomed seemed inevitable; but I can
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: honestly say that the fate of my friends concerned me more greatly than
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did my own.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Beyond the barrier cliffs my party was even now nervously awaiting my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: return.  Presently apprehension and fear would claim them--and they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would never know!  They would attempt to scale the cliffs--of that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was sure; but I was not so positive that they would succeed; and after
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a while they would turn back, what there were left of them, and go
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sadly and mournfully upon their return journey to home.  Home!  I set
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my jaws and tried to forget the word, for I knew that I should never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again see home.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And what of Bowen and his girl?  I had doomed them too.  They would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never even know that an attempt had been made to rescue them.  If they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still lived, they might some day come upon the ruined remnants of this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great plane hanging in its lofty sepulcher and hazard vain guesses and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be filled with wonder; but they would never know; and I could not but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be glad that they would not know that Tom Billings had sealed their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death-warrants by his criminal selfishness.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All these useless regrets were getting me in a bad way; but at last I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shook myself and tried to put such things out of my mind and take hold
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of conditions as they existed and do my level best to wrest victory
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from defeat.  I was badly shaken up and bruised, but considered myself
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mighty lucky to escape with my life.  The plane hung at a precarious
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: angle, so that it was with difficulty and considerable danger that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: climbed from it into the tree and then to the ground.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My predicament was grave.  Between me and my friends lay an inland sea
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fully sixty miles wide at this point and an estimated land-distance of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some three hundred miles around the northern end of the sea, through
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such hideous dangers as I am perfectly free to admit had me pretty well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: buffaloed.  I had seen quite enough of Caspak this day to assure me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that Bowen had in no way exaggerated its perils.  As a matter of fact,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am inclined to believe that he had become so accustomed to them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before he started upon his manuscript that he rather slighted them.  As
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I stood there beneath that tree--a tree which should have been part of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a coal-bed countless ages since--and looked out across a sea teeming
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with frightful life--life which should have been fossil before God
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conceived of Adam--I would not have given a minim of stale beer for my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chances of ever seeing my friends or the outside world again; yet then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and there I swore to fight my way as far through this hideous land as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: circumstances would permit.  I had plenty of ammunition, an automatic
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pistol and a heavy rifle--the latter one of twenty added to our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equipment on the strength of Bowen's description of the huge beasts of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prey which ravaged Caspak.  My greatest danger lay in the hideous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptilia whose low nervous organizations permitted their carnivorous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instincts to function for several minutes after they had ceased to live.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But to these things I gave less thought than to the sudden frustration
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of all our plans.  With the bitterest of thoughts I condemned myself
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the foolish weakness that had permitted me to be drawn from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: main object of my flight into premature and useless exploration.  It
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed to me then that I must be totally eliminated from further search
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for Bowen, since, as I estimated it, the three hundred miles of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian territory I must traverse to reach the base of the cliffs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond which my party awaited me were practically impassable for a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: single individual unaccustomed to Caspakian life and ignorant of all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that lay before him.  Yet I could not give up hope entirely.  My duty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lay clear before me; I must follow it while life remained to me, and so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I set forth toward the north.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The country through which I took my way was as lovely as it was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unusual--I had almost said unearthly, for the plants, the trees, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blooms were not of the earth that I knew.  They were larger, the colors
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more brilliant and the shapes startling, some almost to grotesqueness,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though even such added to the charm and romance of the landscape as the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: giant cacti render weirdly beautiful the waste spots of the sad Mohave.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And over all the sun shone huge and round and red, a monster sun above
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a monstrous world, its light dispersed by the humid air of Caspak--the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warm, moist air which lies sluggish upon the breast of this great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mother of life, Nature's mightiest incubator.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All about me, in every direction, was life.  It moved through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tree-tops and among the boles; it displayed itself in widening and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intermingling circles upon the bosom of the sea; it leaped from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depths; I could hear it in a dense wood at my right, the murmur of it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rising and falling in ceaseless volumes of sound, riven at intervals by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a horrid scream or a thunderous roar which shook the earth; and always
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was haunted by that inexplicable sensation that unseen eyes were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: watching me, that soundless feet dogged my trail.  I am neither nervous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor highstrung; but the burden of responsibility upon me weighed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heavily, so that I was more cautious than is my wont.  I turned often
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to right and left and rear lest I be surprised, and I carried my rifle
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at the ready in my hand.  Once I could have sworn that among the many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure dart from one cover to another, but I could not be sure.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For the most part I skirted the wood, making occasional detours rather
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than enter those forbidding depths of gloom, though many times I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forced to pass through arms of the forest which extended to the very
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shore of the inland sea.  There was so sinister a suggestion in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: uncouth sounds and the vague glimpses of moving things within the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forest, of the menace of strange beasts and possibly still stranger
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men, that I always breathed more freely when I had passed once more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into open country.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had traveled northward for perhaps an hour, still haunted by the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conviction that I was being stalked by some creature which kept always
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hidden among the trees and shrubbery to my right and a little to my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rear, when for the hundredth time I was attracted by a sound from that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction, and turning, saw some animal running rapidly through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forest toward me.  There was no longer any effort on its part at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: concealment; it came on through the underbrush swiftly, and I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: charge me boldly.  Before it finally broke into plain view, I became
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aware that it was not alone, for a few yards in its rear a second thing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thrashed through the leafy jungle.  Evidently I was to be attacked in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: force by a pair of hunting beasts or men.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then through the last clump of waving ferns broke the figure of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foremost creature, which came leaping toward me on light feet as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stood with my rifle to my shoulder covering the point at which I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expected it would emerge.  I must have looked foolish indeed if my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surprise and consternation were in any way reflected upon my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countenance as I lowered my rifle and gazed incredulous at the lithe
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure of the girl speeding swiftly in my direction.  But I did not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have long to stand thus with lowered weapon, for as she came, I saw her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there broke from the jungle at the same spot at which I had seen her,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hugest cat I had ever looked upon.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first I took the beast for a saber-tooth tiger, as it was quite the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most fearsome-appearing beast one could imagine; but it was not that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dread monster of the past, though quite formidable enough to satisfy
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the most fastidious thrill-hunter.  On it came, grim and terrible, its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: baleful eyes glaring above its distended jaws, its lips curled in a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful snarl which exposed a whole mouthful of formidable teeth.  At
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sight of me it had abandoned its impetuous rush and was now sneaking
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slowly toward us; while the girl, a long knife in her hand, took her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stand bravely at my left and a little to my rear.  She had called
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: something to me in a strange tongue as she raced toward me, and now she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spoke again; but what she said I could not then, of course, know--only
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Facing the huge cat, which I now saw was an enormous panther, I waited
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until I could place a shot where I felt it would do the most good, for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at best a frontal shot at any of the large carnivora is a ticklish
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: matter.  I had some advantage in that the beast was not charging; its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head was held low and its back exposed; and so at forty yards I took
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: careful aim at its spine at the junction of neck and shoulders.  But at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the same instant, as though sensing my intention, the great creature
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lifted its head and leaped forward in full charge.  To fire at that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sloping forehead I knew would be worse than useless, and so I quickly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shifted my aim and pulled the trigger, hoping against hope that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soft-nosed bullet and the heavy charge of powder would have sufficient
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stopping effect to give me time to place a second shot.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In answer to the report of the rifle I had the satisfaction of seeing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the brute spring into the air, turning a complete somersault; but it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it to scramble to its feet and get its bearings, it exposed its left
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: side fully toward me, and a second bullet went crashing through its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart.  Down it went for the second time--and then up and at me.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vitality of these creatures of Caspak is one of the marvelous features
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of this strange world and bespeaks the low nervous organization of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: old paleolithic life which has been so long extinct in other portions
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the world.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I put a third bullet into the beast at three paces, and then I thought
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was done for; but it rolled over and stopped at my feet, stone
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead.  I found that my second bullet had torn its heart almost
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: completely away, and yet it had lived to charge ferociously upon me,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and but for my third shot would doubtless have slain me before it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally expired--or as Bowen Tyler so quaintly puts it, before it knew
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it was dead.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With the panther quite evidently conscious of the fact that dissolution
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had overtaken it, I turned toward the girl, who was regarding me with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evident admiration and not a little awe, though I must admit that my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifle claimed quite as much of her attention as did I.  She was quite
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the most wonderful animal that I have ever looked upon, and what few of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her charms her apparel hid, it quite effectively succeeded in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accentuating.  A bit of soft, undressed leather was caught over her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: left shoulder and beneath her right breast, falling upon her left side
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to her hip and upon the right to a metal band which encircled her leg
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above the knee and to which the lowest point of the hide was attached.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About her waist was a loose leather belt, to the center of which was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attached the scabbard belonging to her knife.  There was a single
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: armlet between her right shoulder and elbow, and a series of them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: covered her left forearm from elbow to wrist.  These, I learned later,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: answered the purpose of a shield against knife attack when the left arm
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is raised in guard across the breast or face.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Her masses of heavy hair were held in place by a broad metal band which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bore a large triangular ornament directly in the center of her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forehead.  This ornament appeared to be a huge turquoise, while the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: metal of all her ornaments was beaten, virgin gold, inlaid in intricate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: design with bits of mother-of-pearl and tiny pieces of stone of various
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: colors.  From the left shoulder depended a leopard's tail, while her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet were shod with sturdy little sandals.  The knife was her only
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapon.  Its blade was of iron, the grip was wound with hide and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: protected by a guard of three out-bowing strips of flat iron, and upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the top of the hilt was a knob of gold.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I took in much of this in the few seconds during which we stood facing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: each other, and I also observed another salient feature of her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appearance: she was frightfully dirty!  Her face and limbs and garment
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were streaked with mud and perspiration, and yet even so, I felt that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had never looked upon so perfect and beautiful a creature as she.  Her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure beggars description, and equally so, her face.  Were I one of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these writer-fellows, I should probably say that her features were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Grecian, but being neither a writer nor a poet I can do her greater
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: justice by saying that she combined all of the finest lines that one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sees in the typical American girl's face rather than the pronounced
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sheeplike physiognomy of the Greek goddess.  No, even the dirt couldn't
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hide that fact; she was beautiful beyond compare.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we stood looking at each other, a slow smile came to her face,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: parting her symmetrical lips and disclosing a row of strong white teeth.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Galu?" she asked with rising inflection.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And remembering that I read in Bowen's manuscript that Galu seemed to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indicate a higher type of man, I answered by pointing to myself and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: repeating the word.  Then she started off on a regular catechism, if I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could judge by her inflection, for I certainly understood no word of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what she said.  All the time the girl kept glancing toward the forest,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and at last she touched my arm and pointed in that direction.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Turning, I saw a hairy figure of a manlike thing standing watching us,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and presently another and another emerged from the jungle and joined
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the leader until there must have been at least twenty of them.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they stood upon their feet without touching their hands to the ground,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon with their close-set eyes, flat noses, long upper lips and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "_Alus_!" said the girl.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had reread Bowen's adventures so often that I knew them almost by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart, and so now I knew that I was looking upon the last remnant of

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that ancient man-race--the Alus of a forgotten period--the speechless

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man of antiquity.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "_Kazor_!" cried the girl, and at the same moment the Alus came jabbering
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward us.  They made strange growling, barking noises, as with much
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: baring of fangs they advanced upon us.  They were armed only with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nature's weapons--powerful muscles and giant fangs; yet I knew that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my automatic.  As she did so, her fingers came in contact with mine,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and a sudden thrill ran through me, which I attributed to the fact that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She said something to me in her low, liquid tones; but I could not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand her, and then she pointed toward the north and started away.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I followed her, for my way was north too; but had it been south I still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should have followed, so hungry was I for human companionship in this

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world of beasts and reptiles and half-men.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We walked along, the girl talking a great deal and seeming mystified
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I could not understand her.  Her silvery laugh rang merrily when I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anthropoid ape nor speechless man.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Yet she did not despair, but set out to teach me her language; and had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
