author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instruction prolonged.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I never have been what one might call a ladies' man, though I like
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their company immensely, and during my college days and since have made
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: various friends among the sex.  I think that I rather appeal to a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: certain type of girl for the reason that I never make love to them; I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leave that to the numerous others who do it infinitely better than I

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could hope to, and take my pleasure out of girls' society in what seem

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the like.  Yet in the company of this half-naked little savage I

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of love and I certainly did not love this filthy little barbarian with

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The People That Time Forgot

text: emptied into a large bay at the foot of low cliffs.  Our journey so far
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always upon the alert; for here, to paraphrase, eternal vigilance is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indeed the price of life.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had managed to progress a little in the acquisition of a knowledge of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her tongue, so that I knew many of the animals and reptiles by their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian names, and trees and ferns and grasses.  I knew the words for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: _sea_ and _river_ and _cliff_, for _sky_ and _sun_ and _cloud_.  Yes, I was getting
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: along finely, and then it occurred to me that I didn't know my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: companion's name; so I pointed to myself and said, "Tom," and to her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and raised my eyebrows in interrogation.  The girl ran her fingers into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that mass of hair and looked puzzled.  I repeated the action a dozen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: times.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tom," she said finally in that clear, sweet, liquid voice.  "Tom!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had never thought much of my name before; but when she spoke it, it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sounded to me for the first time in my life like a mighty nice name,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then she brightened suddenly and tapped her own breast and said:
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ajor!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ajor!" I repeated, and she laughed and struck her palms together.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Well, we knew each other's names now, and that was some satisfaction.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I rather liked hers--Ajor!  And she seemed to like mine, for she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: repeated it.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We came to the cliffs beside the little river where it empties into the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bay with the great inland sea beyond.  The cliffs were weather-worn and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rotted, and in one place a deep hollow ran back beneath the overhanging
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stone for several feet, suggesting shelter for the night.  There were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loose rocks strewn all about with which I might build a barricade
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: across the entrance to the cave, and so I halted there and pointed out
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the place to Ajor, trying to make her understand that we would spend
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the night there.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As soon as she grasped my meaning, she assented with the Caspakian
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equivalent of an affirmative nod, and then touching my rifle, motioned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me to follow her to the river.  At the bank she paused, removed her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: belt and dagger, dropping them to the ground at her side; then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unfastening the lower edge of her garment from the metal leg-band to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which it was attached, slipped it off her left shoulder and let it drop
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the ground around her feet.  It was done so naturally, so simply and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so quickly that it left me gasping like a fish out of water.  Turning,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she flashed a smile at me and then dived into the river, and there she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bathed while I stood guard over her.  For five or ten minutes she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: splashed about, and when she emerged her glistening skin was smooth and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: white and beautiful.  Without means of drying herself, she simply
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ignored what to me would have seemed a necessity, and in a moment was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrayed in her simple though effective costume.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was now within an hour of darkness, and as I was nearly famished, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: led the way back about a quarter of a mile to a low meadow where we had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen antelope and small horses a short time before.  Here I brought
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down a young buck, the report of my rifle sending the balance of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: herd scampering for the woods, where they were met by a chorus of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hideous roars as the carnivora took advantage of their panic and leaped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With my hunting-knife I removed a hind-quarter, and then we returned to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: camp.  Here I gathered a great quantity of wood from fallen trees, Ajor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: helping me; but before I built a fire, I also gathered sufficient loose
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rock to build my barricade against the frightful terrors of the night
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to come.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I shall never forget the expression upon Ajor's face as she saw me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strike a match and light the kindling beneath our camp-fire.  It was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such an expression as might transform a mortal face with awe as its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: owner beheld the mysterious workings of divinity.  It was evident that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor was quite unfamiliar with modern methods of fire-making.  She had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought my rifle and pistol wonderful; but these tiny slivers of wood
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which from a magic rub brought flame to the camp hearth were indeed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miracles to her.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the meat roasted above the fire, Ajor and I tried once again to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: talk; but though copiously filled with incentive, gestures and sounds,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the conversation did not flourish notably.  And then Ajor took up in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: earnest the task of teaching me her language.  She commenced, as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: later learned, with the simplest form of speech known to Caspak or for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that matter to the world--that employed by the Bo-lu.  I found it far
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from difficult, and even though it was a great handicap upon my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instructor that she could not speak my language, she did remarkably
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well and demonstrated that she possessed ingenuity and intelligence of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a high order.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After we had eaten, I added to the pile of firewood so that I could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: replenish the fire before the entrance to our barricade, believing this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as good a protection against the carnivora as we could have; and then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor and I sat down before it, and the lesson proceeded, while from all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about us came the weird and awesome noises of the Caspakian night--the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moaning and the coughing and roaring of the tigers, the panthers and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the lions, the barking and the dismal howling of a wolf, jackal and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hyaenadon, the shrill shrieks of stricken prey and the hissing of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great reptiles; the voice of man alone was silent.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But though the voice of this choir-terrible rose and fell from far and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: near in all directions, reaching at time such a tremendous volume of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sound that the earth shook to it, yet so engrossed was I in my lesson
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and in my teacher that often I was deaf to what at another time would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have filled me with awe.  The face and voice of the beautiful girl who
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaned so eagerly toward me as she tried to explain the meaning of some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: word or correct my pronunciation of another quite entirely occupied my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: every faculty of perception.  The firelight shone upon her animated
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: features and sparkling eyes; it accentuated the graceful motions of her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gesturing arms and hands; it sparkled from her white teeth and from her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: golden ornaments, and glistened on the smooth firmness of her perfect
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skin.  I am afraid that often I was more occupied with admiration of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this beautiful animal than with a desire for knowledge; but be that as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it may, I nevertheless learned much that evening, though part of what I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learned had naught to do with any new language.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor seemed determined that I should speak Caspakian as quickly as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possible, and I thought I saw in her desire a little of that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all-feminine trait which has come down through all the ages from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first lady of the world--curiosity.  Ajor desired that I should speak
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her tongue in order that she might satisfy a curiosity concerning me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that was filling her to a point where she was in danger of bursting; of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was positive.  She was a regular little animated question-mark.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She bubbled over with interrogations which were never to be satisfied
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unless I learned to speak her tongue.  Her eyes sparkled with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excitement; her hand flew in expressive gestures; her little tongue
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raced with time; yet all to no avail.  I could say _man_ and _tree_ and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: _cliff_ and _lion_ and a number of other words in perfect Caspakian; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such a vocabulary was only tantalizing; it did not lend itself well to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a very general conversation, and the result was that Ajor would wax so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wroth that she would clench her little fists and beat me on the breast
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as hard as ever she could, and then she would sink back laughing as the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: humor of the situation captured her.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She was trying to teach me some verbs by going through the actions
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: herself as she repeated the proper word.  We were very much
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engrossed--so much so that we were giving no heed to what went on
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond our cave--when Ajor stopped very suddenly, crying:  "_Kazor_!" Now
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she had been trying to teach me that _ju_ meant _stop_; so when she cried
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: _kazor_ and at the same time stopped, I thought for a moment that this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was part of my lesson--for the moment I forgot that _kazor_ means _beware_.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I therefore repeated the word after her; but when I saw the expression
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in her eyes as they were directed past me and saw her point toward the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entrance to the cave, I turned quickly--to see a hideous face at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small aperture leading out into the night.  It was the fierce and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: snarling countenance of a gigantic bear.  I have hunted silvertips in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the White Mountains of Arizona and thought them quite the largest and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most formidable of big game; but from the appearance of the head of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this awful creature I judged that the largest grizzly I had ever seen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would shrink by comparison to the dimensions of a Newfoundland dog.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our fire was just within the cave, the smoke rising through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apertures between the rocks that I had piled in such a way that they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arched inward toward the cliff at the top.  The opening by means of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which we were to reach the outside was barricaded with a few large
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fragments which did not by any means close it entirely; but through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apertures thus left no large animal could gain ingress.  I had depended
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most, however, upon our fire, feeling that none of the dangerous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nocturnal beasts of prey would venture close to the flames.  In this,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: however, I was quite evidently in error, for the great bear stood with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his nose not a foot from the blaze, which was now low, owing to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact that I had been so occupied with my lesson and my teacher that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had neglected to replenish it.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor whipped out her futile little knife and pointed to my rifle.  At
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the same time she spoke in a quite level voice entirely devoid of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nervousness or any evidence of fear or panic.  I knew she was exhorting
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me to fire upon the beast; but this I did not wish to do other than as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a last resort, for I was quite sure that even my heavy bullets would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not more than further enrage him--in which case he might easily force
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an entrance to our cave.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Instead of firing, I piled some more wood upon the fire, and as the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smoke and blaze arose in the beast's face, it backed away, growling
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most frightfully; but I still could see two ugly points of light
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blazing in the outer darkness and hear its growls rumbling terrifically
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without.  For some time the creature stood there watching the entrance
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to our frail sanctuary while I racked my brains in futile endeavor to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plan some method of defense or escape.  I knew full well that should
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bear make a determined effort to get at us, the rocks I had piled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as a barrier would come tumbling down about his giant shoulders like a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: house of cards, and that he would walk directly in upon us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor, having less knowledge of the effectiveness of firearms than I,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and therefore greater confidence in them, entreated me to shoot the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast; but I knew that the chance that I could stop it with a single
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shot was most remote, while that I should but infuriate it was real and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: present; and so I waited for what seemed an eternity, watching those
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: devilish points of fire glaring balefully at us, and listening to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever-increasing volume of those seismic growls which seemed to rumble
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upward from the bowels of the earth, shaking the very cliffs beneath
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which we cowered, until at last I saw that the brute was again
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approaching the aperture.  It availed me nothing that I piled the blaze
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: high with firewood, until Ajor and I were near to roasting; on came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that mighty engine of destruction until once again the hideous face
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yawned its fanged yawn directly within the barrier's opening.  It stood
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thus a moment, and then the head was withdrawn.  I breathed a sigh of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relief, the thing had altered its intention and was going on in search
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of other and more easily procurable prey; the fire had been too much
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for it.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But my joy was short-lived, and my heart sank once again as a moment
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: later I saw a mighty paw insinuated into the opening--a paw as large
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: around as a large dishpan.  Very gently the paw toyed with the great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rock that partly closed the entrance, pushed and pulled upon it and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then very deliberately drew it outward and to one side.  Again came the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head, and this time much farther into the cavern; but still the great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulders would not pass through the opening.  Ajor moved closer to me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until her shoulder touched my side, and I thought I felt a slight
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tremor run through her body, but otherwise she gave no indication of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear.  Involuntarily I threw my left arm about her and drew her to me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for an instant.  It was an act of reassurance rather than a caress,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though I must admit that again and even in the face of death I thrilled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at the contact with her; and then I released her and threw my rifle to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my shoulder, for at last I had reached the conclusion that nothing more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could be gained by waiting.  My only hope was to get as many shots into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the creature as I could before it was upon me.  Already it had torn
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away a second rock and was in the very act of forcing its huge bulk
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the opening it had now made.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So now I took careful aim between its eyes; my right fingers closed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: firmly and evenly upon the small of the stock, drawing back my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trigger-finger by the muscular action of the hand.  The bullet could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not fail to hit its mark!  I held my breath lest I swerve the muzzle a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hair by my breathing.  I was as steady and cool as I ever had been upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a target-range, and I had the full consciousness of a perfect hit in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anticipation; I knew that I could not miss.  And then, as the bear
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surged forward toward me, the hammer fell--futilely, upon an imperfect
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cartridge.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Almost simultaneously I heard from without a perfectly hellish roar;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bear gave voice to a series of growls far transcending in volume
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ferocity anything that he had yet essayed and at the same time
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: backed quickly from the cave.  For an instant I couldn't understand
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what had happened to cause this sudden retreat when his prey was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: practically within his clutches.  The idea that the harmless clicking
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the hammer had frightened him was too ridiculous to entertain.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: However, we had not long to wait before we could at least guess at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cause of the diversion, for from without came mingled growls and roars
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the sound of great bodies thrashing about until the earth shook.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The bear had been attacked in the rear by some other mighty beast, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the two were now locked in a titanic struggle for supremacy.  With
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brief respites, during which we could hear the labored breathing of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contestants, the battle continued for the better part of an hour until
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sounds of combat grew gradually less and finally ceased entirely.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At Ajor's suggestion, made by signs and a few of the words we knew in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: common, I moved the fire directly to the entrance to the cave so that a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast would have to pass directly through the flames to reach us, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then we sat and waited for the victor of the battle to come and claim
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his reward; but though we sat for a long time with our eyes glued to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the opening, we saw no sign of any beast.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I signed to Ajor to lie down, for I knew that she must have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sleep, and I sat on guard until nearly morning, when the girl awoke and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: insisted that I take some rest; nor would she be denied, but dragged me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down as she laughingly menaced me with her knife.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 3
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I awoke, it was daylight, and I found Ajor squatting before a fine
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bed of coals roasting a large piece of antelope-meat.  Believe me, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sight of the new day and the delicious odor of the cooking meat filled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me with renewed happiness and hope that had been all but expunged by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the experience of the previous night; and perhaps the slender figure of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bright-faced girl proved also a potent restorative.  She looked up
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and smiled at me, showing those perfect teeth, and dimpling with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evident happiness--the most adorable picture that I had ever seen.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recall that it was then I first regretted that she was only a little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: untutored savage and so far beneath me in the scale of evolution.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Her first act was to beckon me to follow her outside, and there she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pointed to the explanation of our rescue from the bear--a huge
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saber-tooth tiger, its fine coat and its flesh torn to ribbons, lying
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead a few paces from our cave, and beside it, equally mangled, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disemboweled, was the carcass of a huge cave-bear.  To have had one's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: life saved by a saber-tooth tiger, and in the twentieth century into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bargain, was an experience that was to say the least unique; but it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had happened--I had the proof of it before my eyes.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So enormous are the great carnivora of Caspak that they must feed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perpetually to support their giant thews, and the result is that they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will eat the meat of any other creature and will attack anything that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comes within their ken, no matter how formidable the quarry.  From
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: later observation--I mention this as worthy the attention of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paleontologists and naturalists--I came to the conclusion that such
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creatures as the cave-bear, the cave-lion and the saber-tooth tiger, as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well as the larger carnivorous reptiles make, ordinarily, two kills a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day--one in the morning and one after night.  They immediately devour
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the entire carcass, after which they lie up and sleep for a few hours.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Fortunately their numbers are comparatively few; otherwise there would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be no other life within Caspak.  It is their very voracity that keeps
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their numbers down to a point which permits other forms of life to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: persist, for even in the season of love the great males often turn upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their own mates and devour them, while both males and females
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasionally devour their young.  How the human and semihuman races
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have managed to survive during all the countless ages that these
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conditions must have existed here is quite beyond me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After breakfast Ajor and I set out once more upon our northward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: journey.  We had gone but a little distance when we were attacked by a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: number of apelike creatures armed with clubs.  They seemed a little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: higher in the scale than the Alus.  Ajor told me they were Bo-lu, or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clubmen.  A revolver-shot killed one and scattered the others; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several times later during the day we were menaced by them, until we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had left their country and entered that of the Sto-lu, or hatchet-men.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These people were less hairy and more man-like; nor did they appear so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anxious to destroy us.  Rather they were curious, and followed us for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some distance examining us most closely.  They called out to us, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor answered them; but her replies did not seem to satisfy them, for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they gradually became threatening, and I think they were preparing to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attack us when a small deer that had been hiding in some low brush
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly broke cover and dashed across our front.  We needed meat, for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was near one o'clock and I was getting hungry; so I drew my pistol
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and with a single shot dropped the creature in its tracks.  The effect
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the Bo-lu was electrical.  Immediately they abandoned all thoughts
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of war, and turning, scampered for the forest which fringed our path.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That night we spent beside a little stream in the Sto-lu country.  We
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found a tiny cave in the rock bank, so hidden away that only chance
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could direct a beast of prey to it, and after we had eaten of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deer-meat and some fruit which Ajor gathered, we crawled into the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little hole, and with sticks and stones which I had gathered for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: purpose I erected a strong barricade inside the entrance.  Nothing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could reach us without swimming and wading through the stream, and I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: felt quite secure from attack.  Our quarters were rather cramped.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ceiling was so low that we could not stand up, and the floor so narrow
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it was with difficulty that we both wedged into it together; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were very tired, and so we made the most of it; and so great was the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feeling of security that I am sure I fell asleep as soon as I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stretched myself beside Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During the three days which followed, our progress was exasperatingly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slow.  I doubt if we made ten miles in the entire three days.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country was hideously savage, so that we were forced to spend hours at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a time in hiding from one or another of the great beasts which menaced
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us continually.  There were fewer reptiles; but the quantity of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carnivora seemed to have increased, and the reptiles that we did see
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were perfectly gigantic.  I shall never forget one enormous specimen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which we came upon browsing upon water-reeds at the edge of the great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sea.  It stood well over twelve feet high at the rump, its highest
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: point, and with its enormously long tail and neck it was somewhere
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: between seventy-five and a hundred feet in length.  Its head was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ridiculously small; its body was unarmored, but its great bulk gave it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a most formidable appearance.  My experience of Caspakian life led me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to believe that the gigantic creature would but have to see us to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attack us, and so I raised my rifle and at the same time drew away
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward some brush which offered concealment; but Ajor only laughed, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: picking up a stick, ran toward the great thing, shouting.  The little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head was raised high upon the long neck as the animal stupidly looked
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here and there in search of the author of the disturbance.  At last its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes discovered tiny little Ajor, and then she hurled the stick at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: diminutive head.  With a cry that sounded not unlike the bleat of a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sheep, the colossal creature shuffled into the water and was soon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: submerged.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I slowly recalled my collegiate studies and paleontological readings
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in Bowen's textbooks, I realized that I had looked upon nothing less
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than a diplodocus of the Upper Jurassic; but how infinitely different
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was the true, live thing from the crude restorations of Hatcher and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Holland!  I had had the idea that the diplodocus was a land-animal, but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evidently it is partially amphibious.  I have seen several since my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first encounter, and in each case the creature took to the sea for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: concealment as soon as it was disturbed.  With the exception of its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gigantic tail, it has no weapon of defense; but with this appendage it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: can lash so terrific a blow as to lay low even a giant cave-bear,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stunned and broken.  It is a stupid, simple, gentle beast--one of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: few within Caspak which such a description might even remotely fit.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For three nights we slept in trees, finding no caves or other places of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: concealment.  Here we were free from the attacks of the large land
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carnivora; but the smaller flying reptiles, the snakes, leopards, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: panthers were a constant menace, though by no means as much to be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feared as the huge beasts that roamed the surface of the earth.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the close of the third day Ajor and I were able to converse with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considerable fluency, and it was a great relief to both of us,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: especially to Ajor.  She now did nothing but ask questions whenever I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would let her, which could not be all the time, as our preservation
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depended largely upon the rapidity with which I could gain knowledge of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the geography and customs of Caspak, and accordingly I had to ask
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: numerous questions myself.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I enjoyed immensely hearing and answering her, so naive were many of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her queries and so filled with wonder was she at the things I told her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the world beyond the lofty barriers of Caspak; not once did she seem
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to doubt me, however marvelous my statements must have seemed; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubtless they were the cause of marvel to Ajor, who before had never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dreamed that any life existed beyond Caspak and the life she knew.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Artless though many of her questions were, they evidenced a keen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intellect and a shrewdness which seemed far beyond her years or her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experience.  Altogether I was finding my little savage a mighty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: interesting and companionable person, and I often thanked the kind fate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that directed the crossing of our paths.  From her I learned much of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, but there still remained the mystery that had proved so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: baffling to Bowen Tyler--the total absence of young among the ape, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: semihuman and the human races with which both he and I had come in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contact upon opposite shores of the inland sea.  Ajor tried to explain
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the matter to me, though it was apparent that she could not conceive
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: how so natural a condition should demand explanation.  She told me that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among the Galus there were a few babies, that she had once been a baby
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but that most of her people "came up," as he put it, "_cor sva jo_," or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: literally, "from the beginning"; and as they all did when they used
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that phrase, she would wave a broad gesture toward the south.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "For long," she explained, leaning very close to me and whispering the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: words into my ear while she cast apprehensive glances about and mostly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skyward, "for long my mother kept me hidden lest the Wieroo, passing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the air by night, should come and take me away to Oo-oh."  And
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the child shuddered as she voiced the word.  I tried to get her to tell
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me more; but her terror was so real when she spoke of the Wieroo and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the land of Oo-oh where they dwell that I at last desisted, though I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did learn that the Wieroo carried off only female babes and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasionally women of the Galus who had "come up from the beginning."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was all very mysterious and unfathomable, but I got the idea that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Wieroo were creatures of imagination--the demons or gods of her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: race, omniscient and omnipresent.  This led me to assume that the Galus
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had a religious sense, and further questioning brought out the fact
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that such was the case.  Ajor spoke in tones of reverence of Luata, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: god of heat and life.  The word is derived from two others:  _Lua_,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meaning sun, and _ata_, meaning variously _eggs_, _life_, _young_, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: _reproduction_.  She told me that they worshiped Luata in several forms,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as fire, the sun, eggs and other material objects which suggested heat
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and reproduction.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had noticed that whenever I built a fire, Ajor outlined in the air
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before her with a forefinger an isosceles triangle, and that she did
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the same in the morning when she first viewed the sun.  At first I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not connected her act with anything in particular, but after we learned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to converse and she had explained a little of her religious
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: superstitions, I realized that she was making the sign of the triangle
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as a Roman Catholic makes the sign of the cross.  Always the short side
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the triangle was uppermost.  As she explained all this to me, she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pointed to the decorations on her golden armlets, upon the knob of her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dagger-hilt and upon the band which encircled her right leg above the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knee--always was the design partly made up of isosceles triangles, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when she explained the significance of this particular geometric
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure, I at once grasped its appropriateness.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were now in the country of the Band-lu, the spearmen of Caspak.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen had remarked in his narrative that these people were analogous to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the so-called Cro-Magnon race of the Upper Paleolithic, and I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: therefore very anxious to see them.  Nor was I to be disappointed; I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw them, all right!  We had left the Sto-lu country and literally
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fought our way through cordons of wild beasts for two days when we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decided to make camp a little earlier than usual, owing to the fact
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that we had reached a line of cliffs running east and west in which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were numerous likely cave-lodgings.  We were both very tired, and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sight of these caverns, several of which could be easily barricaded,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decided us to halt until the following morning.  It took but a few
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: minutes' exploration to discover one particular cavern high up the face
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cliff which seemed ideal for our purpose.  It opened upon a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow ledge where we could build our cook-fire; the opening was so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small that we had to lie flat and wriggle through it to gain ingress,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while the interior was high-ceiled and spacious.  I lighted a faggot
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and looked about; but as far as I could see, the chamber ran back into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Laying aside my rifle, pistol and heavy ammunition-belt, I left Ajor in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cave while I went down to gather firewood.  We already had meat and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fruits which we had gathered just before reaching the cliffs, and my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: canteen was filled with fresh water.  Therefore, all we required was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fuel, and as I always saved Ajor's strength when I could, I would not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: permit her to accompany me.  The poor girl was very tired; but she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have gone with me until she dropped, I know, so loyal was she.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She was the best comrade in the world, and sometimes I regretted and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sometimes I was glad that she was not of my own caste, for had she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been, I should unquestionably have fallen in love with her.  As it was,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we traveled together like two boys, with huge respect for each other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but no softer sentiment.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was little timber close to the base of the cliffs, and so I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forced to enter the wood some two hundred yards distant.  I realize now
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: how foolhardy was my act in such a land as Caspak, teeming with danger
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and with death; but there is a certain amount of fool in every man; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whatever proportion of it I own must have been in the ascendant that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day, for the truth of the matter is that I went down into those woods
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: absolutely defenseless; and I paid the price, as people usually do for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their indiscretions.  As I searched around in the brush for likely
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pieces of firewood, my head bowed and my eyes upon the ground, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly felt a great weight hurl itself upon me.  I struggled to my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knees and seized my assailant, a huge, naked man--naked except for a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breechcloth of snakeskin, the head hanging down to the knees.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellow was armed with a stone-shod spear, a stone knife and a hatchet.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In his black hair were several gay-colored feathers.  As we struggled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to and fro, I was slowly gaining advantage of him, when a score of his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellows came running up and overpowered me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They bound my hands behind me with long rawhide thongs and then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surveyed me critically.  I found them fine-looking specimens of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manhood, for the most part.  There were some among them who bore a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: resemblance to the Sto-lu and were hairy; but the majority had massive
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heads and not unlovely features.  There was little about them to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suggest the ape, as in the Sto-lu, Bo-lu and Alus.  I expected them to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kill me at once, but they did not.  Instead they questioned me; but it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was evident that they did not believe my story, for they scoffed and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laughed.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The Galus have turned you out," they cried.  "If you go back to them,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you will die.  If you remain here, you will die.  We shall kill you;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but first we shall have a dance and you shall dance with us--the dance
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of death."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It sounded quite reassuring!  But I knew that I was not to be killed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediately, and so I took heart.  They led me toward the cliffs, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as we approached them, I glanced up and was sure that I saw Ajor's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bright eyes peering down upon us from our lofty cave; but she gave no
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sign if she saw me; and we passed on, rounded the end of the cliffs and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: proceeded along the opposite face of them until we came to a section
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: literally honeycombed with caves.  All about, upon the ground and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: swarming the ledges before the entrances, were hundreds of members of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the tribe.  There were many women but no babes or children, though I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noticed that the females had better developed breasts than any that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had seen among the hatchet-men, the club-men, the Alus or the apes.  In
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact, among the lower orders of Caspakian man the female breast is but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a rudimentary organ, barely suggested in the apes and Alus, and only a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little more defined in the Bo-lu and Sto-lu, though always increasingly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so until it is found about half developed in the females of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spear-men; yet never was there an indication that the females had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suckled young; nor were there any young among them.  Some of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu women were quite comely.  The figures of all, both men and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women, were symmetrical though heavy, and though there were some who
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: verged strongly upon the Sto-lu type, there were others who were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: positively handsome and whose bodies were quite hairless.  The Alus are
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all bearded, but among the Bo-lu the beard disappears in the women.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Sto-lu men show a sparse beard, the Band-lu none; and there is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little hair upon the bodies of their women.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The members of the tribe showed great interest in me, especially in my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clothing, the like of which, of course, they never had seen.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pulled and hauled upon me, and some of them struck me; but for the most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: part they were not inclined to brutality.  It was only the hairier
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ones, who most closely resembled the Sto-lu, who maltreated me.  At
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: last my captors led me into a great cave in the mouth of which a fire
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was burning.  The floor was littered with filth, including the bones of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many animals, and the atmosphere reeked with the stench of human bodies
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and putrefying flesh.  Here they fed me, releasing my arms, and I ate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of half-cooked aurochs steak and a stew which may have been made of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: snakes, for many of the long, round pieces of meat suggested them most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nauseatingly.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The meal completed, they led me well within the cavern, which they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lighted with torches stuck in various crevices in the light of which I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw, to my astonishment, that the walls were covered with paintings and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: etchings.  There were aurochs, red deer, saber-tooth tiger, cave-bear,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hyaenadon and many other examples of the fauna of Caspak done in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: colors, usually of four shades of brown, or scratched upon the surface
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the rock.  Often they were super-imposed upon each other until it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: required careful examination to trace out the various outlines.  But
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they all showed a rather remarkable aptitude for delineation which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: further fortified Bowen's comparisons between these people and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extinct Cro-Magnons whose ancient art is still preserved in the caverns
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Niaux and Le Portel.  The Band-lu, however, did not have the bow and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrow, and in this respect they differ from their extinct progenitors,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or descendants, of Western Europe.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Should any of my friends chance to read the story of my adventures upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caprona, I hope they will not be bored by these diversions, and if they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are, I can only say that I am writing my memoirs for my own edification
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and therefore setting down those things which interested me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: particularly at the time.  I have no desire that the general public
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should ever have access to these pages; but it is possible that my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friends may, and also certain savants who are interested; and to them,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while I do not apologize for my philosophizing, I humbly explain that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they are witnessing the gropings of a finite mind after the infinite,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the search for explanations of the inexplicable.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In a far recess of the cavern my captors bade me halt.  Again my hands
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were secured, and this time my feet as well.  During the operation they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: questioned me, and I was mighty glad that the marked similarity between
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the various tribal tongues of Caspak enabled us to understand each
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: other perfectly, even though they were unable to believe or even to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comprehend the truth of my origin and the circumstances of my advent in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak; and finally they left me saying that they would come for me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before the dance of death upon the morrow.  Before they departed with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their torches, I saw that I had not been conducted to the farthest
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extremity of the cavern, for a dark and gloomy corridor led beyond my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prison room into the heart of the cliff.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could not but marvel at the immensity of this great underground
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grotto.  Already I had traversed several hundred yards of it, from many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: points of which other corridors diverged.  The whole cliff must be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: honeycombed with apartments and passages of which this community
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occupied but a comparatively small part, so that the possibility of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more remote passages being the lair of savage beasts that have other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: means of ingress and egress than that used by the Band-lu filled me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with dire forebodings.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I believe that I am not ordinarily hysterically apprehensive; yet I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must confess that under the conditions with which I was confronted, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: felt my nerves to be somewhat shaken.  On the morrow I was to die some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sort of nameless death for the diversion of a savage horde, but the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: morrow held fewer terrors for me than the present, and I submit to any
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fair-minded man if it is not a terrifying thing to lie bound hand and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foot in the Stygian blackness of an immense cave peopled by unknown
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangers in a land overrun by hideous beasts and reptiles of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greatest ferocity.  At any moment, perhaps at this very moment, some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: silent-footed beast of prey might catch my scent where it laired in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some contiguous passage, and might creep stealthily upon me.  I craned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my neck about, and stared through the inky darkness for the twin spots
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of blazing hate which I knew would herald the coming of my executioner.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So real were the imaginings of my overwrought brain that I broke into a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cold sweat in absolute conviction that some beast was close before me;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yet the hours dragged, and no sound broke the grave-like stillness of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cavern.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During that period of eternity many events of my life passed before my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mental vision, a vast parade of friends and occurrences which would be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blotted out forever on the morrow.  I cursed myself for the foolish act
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which had taken me from the search-party that so depended upon me, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wondered what progress, if any, they had made.  Were they still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond the barrier cliffs, awaiting my return?  Or had they found a way
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into Caspak?  I felt that the latter would be the truth, for the party
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was not made up of men easily turned from a purpose.  Quite probable it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was that they were already searching for me; but that they would ever
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: find a trace of me I doubted.  Long since, had I come to the conclusion
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it was beyond human prowess to circle the shores of the inland sea
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Caspak in the face of the myriad menaces which lurked in every
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shadow by day and by night.  Long since, had I given up any hope of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reaching the point where I had made my entry into the country, and so I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was now equally convinced that our entire expedition had been worse
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than futile before ever it was conceived, since Bowen J.  Tyler and his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wife could not by any possibility have survived during all these long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
