text: months; no more could Bradley and his party of seamen be yet in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: existence.  If the superior force and equipment of my party enabled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them to circle the north end of the sea, they might some day come upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the broken wreck of my plane hanging in the great tree to the south;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but long before that, my bones would be added to the litter upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: floor of this mighty cavern.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And through all my thoughts, real and fanciful, moved the image of a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perfect girl, clear-eyed and strong and straight and beautiful, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the carriage of a queen and the supple, undulating grace of a leopard.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Though I loved my friends, their fate seemed of less importance to me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than the fate of this little barbarian stranger for whom, I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: convinced myself many a time, I felt no greater sentiment than passing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friendship for a fellow-wayfarer in this land of horrors.  Yet I so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worried and fretted about her and her future that at last I quite
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forgot my own predicament, though I still struggled intermittently with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my bonds in vain endeavor to free myself; as much, however, that I might
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hasten to her protection as that I might escape the fate which had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: planned for me.  And while I was thus engaged and had for the moment
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forgotten my apprehensions concerning prowling beasts, I was startled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into tense silence by a distinct and unmistakable sound coming from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dark corridor farther toward the heart of the cliff--the sound of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: padded feet moving stealthily in my direction.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I believe that never before in all my life, even amidst the terrors of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: childhood nights, have I suffered such a sensation of extreme horror as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did that moment in which I realized that I must lie bound and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: helpless while some horrid beast of prey crept upon me to devour me in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that utter darkness of the Band-lu pits of Caspak.  I reeked with cold
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sweat, and my flesh crawled--I could feel it crawl.  If ever I came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nearer to abject cowardice, I do not recall the instance; and yet it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was not that I was afraid to die, for I had long since given myself up
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as lost--a few days of Caspak must impress anyone with the utter
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothingness of life.  The waters, the land, the air teem with it, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always it is being devoured by some other form of life.  Life is the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cheapest thing in Caspak, as it is the cheapest thing on earth and,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubtless, the cheapest cosmic production.  No, I was not afraid to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: die; in fact, I prayed for death, that I might be relieved of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightfulness of the interval of life which remained to me--the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: waiting, the awful waiting, for that fearsome beast to reach me and to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strike.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently it was so close that I could hear its breathing, and then it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: touched me and leaped quickly back as though it had come upon me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unexpectedly.  For long moments no sound broke the sepulchral silence
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cave.  Then I heard a movement on the part of the creature near
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, and again it touched me, and I felt something like a hairless hand
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pass over my face and down until it touched the collar of my flannel
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shirt.  And then, subdued, but filled with pent emotion, a voice cried:
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tom!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I think I nearly fainted, so great was the reaction.  "Ajor!"  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: managed to say.  "Ajor, my girl, can it be you?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Oh, Tom!" she cried again in a trembly little voice and flung herself
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon me, sobbing softly.  I had not known that Ajor could cry.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As she cut away my bonds, she told me that from the entrance to our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave she had seen the Band-lu coming out of the forest with me, and she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had followed until they took me into the cave, which she had seen was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the opposite side of the cliff in which ours was located; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then, knowing that she could do nothing for me until after the Band-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slept, she had hastened to return to our cave.  With difficulty she had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reached it, after having been stalked by a cave-lion and almost seized.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I trembled at the risk she had run.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It had been her intention to wait until after midnight, when most of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the carnivora would have made their kills, and then attempt to reach
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cave in which I was imprisoned and rescue me.  She explained that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with my rifle and pistol--both of which she assured me she could use,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: having watched me so many times--she planned upon frightening the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu and forcing them to give me up.  Brave little girl!  She would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have risked her life willingly to save me.  But some time after she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reached our cave she heard voices from the far recesses within, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediately concluded that we had but found another entrance to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: caves which the Band-lu occupied upon the other face of the cliff.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then she had set out through those winding passages and in total
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: darkness had groped her way, guided solely by a marvelous sense of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction, to where I lay.  She had had to proceed with utmost caution
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lest she fall into some abyss in the darkness and in truth she had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thrice come upon sheer drops and had been forced to take the most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful risks to pass them.  I shudder even now as I contemplate what
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this girl passed through for my sake and how she enhanced her peril in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loading herself down with the weight of my arms and ammunition and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: awkwardness of the long rifle which she was unaccustomed to bearing.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could have knelt and kissed her hand in reverence and gratitude; nor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: am I ashamed to say that that is precisely what I did after I had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: freed from my bonds and heard the story of her trials.  Brave little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor!  Wonder-girl out of the dim, unthinkable past!  Never before had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she been kissed; but she seemed to sense something of the meaning of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the new caress, for she leaned forward in the dark and pressed her own
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lips to my forehead.  A sudden urge surged through me to seize her and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strain her to my bosom and cover her hot young lips with the kisses of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a real love, but I did not do so, for I knew that I did not love her;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and to have kissed her thus, with passion, would have been to inflict a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great wrong upon her who had offered her life for mine.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: No, Ajor should be as safe with me as with her own mother, if she had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one, which I was inclined to doubt, even though she told me that she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had once been a babe and hidden by her mother.  I had come to doubt if
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there was such a thing as a mother in Caspak, a mother such as we know.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From the Bo-lu to the Kro-lu there is no word which corresponds with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our word mother.  They speak of _ata_ and _cor sva jo:, meaning
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: _reproduction_ and _from the beginning_, and point toward the south; but no
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one has a mother.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After considerable difficulty we gained what we thought was our cave,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only to find that it was not, and then we realized that we were lost in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the labyrinthine mazes of the great cavern.  We retraced our steps and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sought the point from which we had started, but only succeeded in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: losing ourselves the more.  Ajor was aghast--not so much from fear of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our predicament; but that she should have failed in the functioning of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that wonderful sense she possessed in common with most other creatures
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian, which makes it possible for them to move unerringly from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: place to place without compass or guide.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hand in hand we crept along, searching for an opening into the outer
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world, yet realizing that at each step we might be burrowing more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deeply into the heart of the great cliff, or circling futilely in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: vague wandering that could end only in death.  And the darkness!  It
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was almost palpable, and utterly depressing.  I had matches, and in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some of the more difficult places I struck one; but we couldn't afford
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to waste them, and so we groped our way slowly along, doing the best we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could to keep to one general direction in the hope that it would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eventually lead us to an opening into the outer world.  When I struck
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: matches, I noticed that the walls bore no paintings; nor was there
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: other sign that man had penetrated this far within the cliff, nor any
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spoor of animals of other kinds.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It would be difficult to guess at the time we spent wandering through
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: those black corridors, climbing steep ascents, feeling our way along
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the edges of bottomless pits, never knowing at what moment we might be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plunged into some abyss and always haunted by the ever-present terror
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of death by starvation and thirst.  As difficult as it was, I still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized that it might have been infinitely worse had I had another
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: companion than Ajor--courageous, uncomplaining, loyal little Ajor!  She
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was tired and hungry and thirsty, and she must have been discouraged;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but she never faltered in her cheerfulness.  I asked her if she was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: afraid, and she replied that here the Wieroo could not get her, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that if she died of hunger, she would at least die with me and she was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite content that such should be her end.  At the time I attributed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her attitude to something akin to a doglike devotion to a new master
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who had been kind to her.  I can take oath to the fact that I did not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: think it was anything more.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whether we had been imprisoned in the cliff for a day or a week I could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not say; nor even now do I know.  We became very tired and hungry; the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hours dragged; we slept at least twice, and then we rose and stumbled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on, always weaker and weaker.  There were ages during which the trend
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the corridors was always upward.  It was heartbreaking work for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: people in the state of exhaustion in which we then were, but we clung
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tenaciously to it.  We stumbled and fell; we sank through pure physical
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inability to retain our feet; but always we managed to rise at last and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go on.  At first, wherever it had been possible, we had walked hand in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hand lest we become separated, and later, when I saw that Ajor was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weakening rapidly, we went side by side, I supporting her with an arm
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about her waist.  I still retained the heavy burden of my armament; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the rifle slung to my back, my hands were free.  When I too showed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indisputable evidences of exhaustion, Ajor suggested that I lay aside
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my arms and ammunition; but I told her that as it would mean certain
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death for me to traverse Caspak without them, I might as well take the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chance of dying here in the cave with them, for there was the other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chance that we might find our way to liberty.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There came a time when Ajor could no longer walk, and then it was that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I picked her up in my arms and carried her.  She begged me to leave
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her, saying that after I found an exit, I could come back and get her;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but she knew, and she knew that I knew, that if ever I did leave her, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could never find her again.  Yet she insisted.  Barely had I sufficient
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strength to take a score of steps at a time; then I would have to sink
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down and rest for five to ten minutes.  I don't know what force urged
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me on and kept me going in the face of an absolute conviction that my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: efforts were utterly futile.  I counted us already as good as dead; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still I dragged myself along until the time came that I could no longer
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rise, but could only crawl along a few inches at a time, dragging Ajor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beside me.  Her sweet voice, now almost inaudible from weakness,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: implored me to abandon her and save myself--she seemed to think only of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me.  Of course I couldn't have left her there alone, no matter how much
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I might have desired to do so; but the fact of the matter was that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: didn't desire to leave her.  What I said to her then came very simply
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and naturally to my lips.  It couldn't very well have been otherwise, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine, for with death so close, I doubt if people are much inclined
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to heroics.  "I would rather not get out at all, Ajor," I said to her,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "than to get out without you."  We were resting against a rocky wall,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Ajor was leaning against me, her head on my breast.  I could feel
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her press closer to me, and one hand stroked my arm in a weak caress;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but she didn't say anything, nor were words necessary.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After a few minutes' more rest, we started on again upon our utterly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hopeless way; but I soon realized that I was weakening rapidly, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently I was forced to admit that I was through.  "It's no use,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor," I said, "I've come as far as I can.  It may be that if I sleep,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I can go on again after," but I knew that that was not true, and that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the end was near.  "Yes, sleep," said Ajor.  "We will sleep
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: together--forever."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She crept close to me as I lay on the hard floor and pillowed her head
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon my arm.  With the little strength which remained to me, I drew her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up until our lips touched, and, then I whispered: "Good-bye!"  I must
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have lost consciousness almost immediately, for I recall nothing more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until I suddenly awoke out of a troubled sleep, during which I dreamed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was drowning, to find the cave lighted by what appeared to be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: diffused daylight, and a tiny trickle of water running down the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corridor and forming a puddle in the little depression in which it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chanced that Ajor and I lay.  I turned my eyes quickly upon Ajor,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fearful for what the light might disclose; but she still breathed,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though very faintly.  Then I searched about for an explanation of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: light, and soon discovered that it came from about a bend in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corridor just ahead of us and at the top of a steep incline; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instantly I realized that Ajor and I had stumbled by night almost to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the portal of salvation.  Had chance taken us a few yards further, up
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either of the corridors which diverged from ours just ahead of us, we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might have been irrevocably lost; we might still be lost; but at least
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could die in the light of day, out of the horrid blackness of this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrible cave.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I tried to rise, and found that sleep had given me back a portion of my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strength; and then I tasted the water and was further refreshed.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shook Ajor gently by the shoulder; but she did not open her eyes, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then I gathered a few drops of water in my cupped palm and let them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trickle between her lips.  This revived her so that she raised her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lids, and when she saw me, she smiled.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What happened?" she asked.  "Where are we?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We are at the end of the corridor," I replied, "and daylight is coming
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in from the outside world just ahead.  We are saved, Ajor!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She sat up then and looked about, and then, quite womanlike, she burst
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into tears.  It was the reaction, of course; and then too, she was very
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weak.  I took her in my arms and quieted her as best I could, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally, with my help, she got to her feet; for she, as well as I, had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found some slight recuperation in sleep.  Together we staggered upward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the light, and at the first turn we saw an opening a few yards
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ahead of us and a leaden sky beyond--a leaden sky from which was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: falling a drizzling rain, the author of our little, trickling stream
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which had given us drink when we were most in need of it.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The cave had been damp and cold; but as we crawled through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aperture, the muggy warmth of the Caspakian air caressed and confronted
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us; even the rain was warmer than the atmosphere of those dark
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corridors.  We had water now, and warmth, and I was sure that Caspak
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would soon offer us meat or fruit; but as we came to where we could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: look about, we saw that we were upon the summit of the cliffs, where
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there seemed little reason to expect game.  However, there were trees,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and among them we soon descried edible fruits with which we broke our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long fast.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 4
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We spent two days upon the cliff-top, resting and recuperating.  There
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was some small game which gave us meat, and the little pools of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rainwater were sufficient to quench our thirst.  The sun came out a few
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hours after we emerged from the cave, and in its warmth we soon cast
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off the gloom which our recent experiences had saddled upon us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Upon the morning of the third day we set out to search for a path down
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the valley.  Below us, to the north, we saw a large pool lying at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the foot of the cliffs, and in it we could discern the women of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu lying in the shallow waters, while beyond and close to the base
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the mighty barrier-cliffs there was a large party of Band-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors going north to hunt.  We had a splendid view from our lofty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliff-top.  Dimly, to the west, we could see the farther shore of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inland sea, and southwest the large southern island loomed distinctly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before us.  A little east of north was the northern island, which Ajor,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shuddering, whispered was the home of the Wieroo--the land of Oo-oh.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It lay at the far end of the lake and was barely visible to us, being
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fully sixty miles away.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From our elevation, and in a clearer atmosphere, it would have stood
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out distinctly; but the air of Caspak is heavy with moisture, with the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: result that distant objects are blurred and indistinct.  Ajor also told
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me that the mainland east of Oo-oh was her land--the land of the Galu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She pointed out the cliffs at its southern boundary, which mark the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frontier, south of which lies the country of Kro-lu--the archers.  We
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now had but to pass through the balance of the Band-lu territory and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that of the Kro-lu to be within the confines of her own land; but that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meant traversing thirty-five miles of hostile country filled with every
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imaginable terror, and possibly many beyond the powers of imagination.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I would certainly have given a lot for my plane at that moment, for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with it, twenty minutes would have landed us within the confines of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor's country.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We finally found a place where we could slip over the edge of the cliff
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: onto a narrow ledge which seemed to give evidence of being something of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a game-path to the valley, though it apparently had not been used for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some time.  I lowered Ajor at the end of my rifle and then slid over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself, and I am free to admit that my hair stood on end during the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: process, for the drop was considerable and the ledge appallingly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow, with a frightful drop sheer below down to the rocks at the base
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the cliff; but with Ajor there to catch and steady me, I made it all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right, and then we set off down the trail toward the valley.  There
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were two or three more bad places, but for the most part it was an easy
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: descent, and we came to the highest of the Band-lu caves without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: further trouble.  Here we went more slowly, lest we should be set upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by some member of the tribe.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We must have passed about half the Band-lu cave-levels before we were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accosted, and then a huge fellow stepped out in front of me, barring
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our further progress.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you?" he asked; and he recognized me and I him, for he had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been one of those who had led me back into the cave and bound me the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: night that I had been captured.  From me his gaze went to Ajor.  He was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a fine-looking man with clear, intelligent eyes, a good forehead and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: superb physique--by far the highest type of Caspakian I had yet seen,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barring Ajor, of course.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are a true Galu," he said to Ajor, "but this man is of a different
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mold.  He has the face of a Galu, but his weapons and the strange skins
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he wears upon his body are not of the Galus nor of Caspak.  Who is he?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He is Tom," replied Ajor succinctly.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There is no such people," asserted the Band-lu quite truthfully,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toying with his spear in a most suggestive manner.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "My name is Tom," I explained, "and I am from a country beyond Caspak."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I thought it best to propitiate him if possible, because of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessity of conserving ammunition as well as to avoid the loud alarm
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a shot which might bring other Band-lu warriors upon us.  "I am from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: America, a land of which you never heard, and I am seeking others of my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countrymen who are in Caspak and from whom I am lost. I have no quarrel
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with you or your people.  Let us go our way in peace."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are going there?" he asked, and pointed toward the north.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am," I replied.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was silent for several minutes, apparently weighing some thought in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his mind.  At last he spoke.  "What is that?" he asked.  "And what is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that?"  He pointed first at my rifle and then to my pistol.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They are weapons," I replied, "weapons which kill at a great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distance." I pointed to the women in the pool beneath us.  "With this,"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I said, tapping my pistol, "I could kill as many of those women as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cared to, without moving a step from where we now stand."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked his incredulity, but I went on.  "And with this"--I weighed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my rifle at the balance in the palm of my right hand--"I could slay one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of those distant warriors."  And I waved my left hand toward the tiny
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figures of the hunters far to the north.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The fellow laughed.  "Do it," he cried derisively, "and then it may be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I shall believe the balance of your strange story."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But I do not wish to kill any of them," I replied.  "Why should I?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why not?" he insisted.  "They would have killed you when they had you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prisoner.  They would kill you now if they could get their hands on
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you, and they would eat you into the bargain.  But I know why you do
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not try it--it is because you have spoken lies; your weapon will not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kill at a great distance.  It is only a queerly wrought club.  For all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I know, you are nothing more than a lowly Bo-lu."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why should you wish me to kill your own people?" I asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They are no longer my people," he replied proudly.  "Last night, in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the very middle of the night, the call came to me.  Like that it came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into my head"--and he struck his hands together smartly once--"that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had risen.  I have been waiting for it and expecting it for a long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time; today I am a Kro-lu.  Today I go into the coslupak" (unpeopled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country, or literally, no man's land) "between the Band-lu and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu, and there I fashion my bow and my arrows and my shield; there I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hunt the red deer for the leathern jerkin which is the badge of my new
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: estate.  When these things are done, I can go to the chief of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu, and he dare not refuse me.  That is why you may kill those low
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu if you wish to live, for I am in a hurry.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But why do you wish to kill me?" I asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked puzzled and finally gave it up.  "I do not know," he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: admitted.  "It is the way in Caspak.  If we do not kill, we shall be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed, therefore it is wise to kill first whomever does not belong to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one's own people.  This morning I hid in my cave till the others were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gone upon the hunt, for I knew that they would know at once that I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: become a Kro-lu and would kill me.  They will kill me if they find me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the coslupak; so will the Kro-lu if they come upon me before I have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: won my Kro-lu weapons and jerkin.  You would kill me if you could, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that is the reason I know that you speak lies when you say that your
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons will kill at a great distance.  Would they, you would long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since have killed me.  Come!  I have no more time to waste in words.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will spare the woman and take her with me to the Kro-lu, for she is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comely."  And with that he advanced upon me with raised spear.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My rifle was at my hip at the ready.  He was so close that I did not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: need to raise it to my shoulder, having but to pull the trigger to send
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him into Kingdom Come whenever I chose; but yet I hesitated.  It was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: difficult to bring myself to take a human life.  I could feel no enmity
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward this savage barbarian who acted almost as wholly upon instinct
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as might a wild beast, and to the last moment I was determined to seek
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: some way to avoid what now seemed inevitable.  Ajor stood at my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulder, her knife ready in her hand and a sneer on her lips at his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suggestion that he would take her with him.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Just as I thought I should have to fire, a chorus of screams broke from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the women beneath us.  I saw the man halt and glance downward, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: following his example my eyes took in the panic and its cause.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women had, evidently, been quitting the pool and slowly returning
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the caves, when they were confronted by a monstrous cave-lion
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which stood directly between them and their cliffs in the center of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow path that led down to the pool among the tumbled rocks.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Screaming, the women were rushing madly back to the pool.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It will do them no good," remarked the man, a trace of excitement in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his voice.  "It will do them no good, for the lion will wait until they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come out and take as many as he can carry away; and there is one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there," he added, a trace of sadness in his tone, "whom I hoped would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soon follow me to the Kro-lu.  Together have we come up from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beginning."  He raised his spear above his head and poised it ready to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hurl downward at the lion.  "She is nearest to him," he muttered.  "He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will get her and she will never come to me among the Kro-lu, or ever
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thereafter.  It is useless!  No warrior lives who could hurl a weapon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so great a distance."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But even as he spoke, I was leveling my rifle upon the great brute
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below; and as he ceased speaking, I squeezed the trigger.  My bullet
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must have struck to a hair the point at which I had aimed, for it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smashed the brute's spine back of his shoulders and tore on through his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart, dropping him dead in his tracks.  For a moment the women were as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrified by the report of the rifle as they had been by the menace of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the lion; but when they saw that the loud noise had evidently destroyed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their enemy, they came creeping cautiously back to examine the carcass.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The man, toward whom I had immediately turned after firing, lest he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should pursue his threatened attack, stood staring at me in amazement
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and admiration.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why," he asked, "if you could do that, did you not kill me long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I told you," I replied, "that I had no quarrel with you.  I do not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: care to kill men with whom I have no quarrel."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But he could not seem to get the idea through his head.  "I can believe
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now that you are not of Caspak," he admitted, "for no Caspakian would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have permitted such an opportunity to escape him." This, however, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found later to be an exaggeration, as the tribes of the west coast and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even the Kro-lu of the east coast are far less bloodthirsty than he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have had me believe.  "And your weapon!" he continued.  "You
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spoke true words when I thought you spoke lies."  And then, suddenly:
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Let us be friends!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I turned to Ajor.  "Can I trust him?" I asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," she replied.  "Why not?  Has he not asked to be friends?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was not at the time well enough acquainted with Caspakian ways to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: know that truthfulness and loyalty are two of the strongest
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: characteristics of these primitive people.  They are not sufficiently
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cultured to have become adept in hypocrisy, treason and dissimulation.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There are, of course, a few exceptions.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We can go north together," continued the warrior.  "I will fight for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you, and you can fight for me.  Until death will I serve you, for you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have saved So-al, whom I had given up as dead."  He threw down his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spear and covered both his eyes with the palms of his two hands.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked inquiringly toward Ajor, who explained as best she could that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this was the form of the Caspakian oath of allegiance.  "You need never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear him after this," she concluded.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What should I do?" I asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Take his hands down from before his eyes and return his spear to him,"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she explained.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I did as she bade, and the man seemed very pleased.  I then asked what
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I should have done had I not wished to accept his friendship.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: told me that had I walked away, the moment that I was out of sight of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the warrior we would have become deadly enemies again.  "But I could so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: easily have killed him as he stood there defenseless!" I exclaimed.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," replied the warrior, "but no man with good sense blinds his eyes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before one whom he does not trust."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was rather a decent compliment, and it taught me just how much I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might rely on the loyalty of my new friend.  I was glad to have him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with us, for he knew the country and was evidently a fearless warrior.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wished that I might have recruited a battalion like him.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the women were now approaching the cliffs, To-mar the warrior
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suggested that we make our way to the valley before they could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intercept us, as they might attempt to detain us and were almost
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: certain to set upon Ajor.  So we hastened down the narrow path,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reaching the foot of the cliffs but a short distance ahead of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: women.  They called after us to stop; but we kept on at a rapid walk,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not wishing to have any trouble with them, which could only result in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the death of some of them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We had proceeded about a mile when we heard some one behind us calling
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To-mar by name, and when we stopped and looked around, we saw a woman
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: running rapidly toward us.  As she approached nearer I could see that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she was a very comely creature, and like all her sex that I had seen in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, apparently young.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is So-al!" exclaimed To-mar.  "Is she mad that she follows me thus?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In another moment the young woman stopped, panting, before us.  She
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: paid not the slightest attention to Ajor or me; but devouring To-mar
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with her sparkling eyes, she cried:  "I have risen!  I have risen!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "So-al!" was all that the man could say.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," she went on, "the call came to me just before I quit the pool;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but I did not know that it had come to you.  I can see it in your eyes,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To-mar, my To-mar!  We shall go on together!"  And she threw herself
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into his arms.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a very affecting sight, for it was evident that these two had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been mates for a long time and that they had each thought that they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were about to be separated by that strange law of evolution which holds
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: good in Caspak and which was slowly unfolding before my incredulous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind.  I did not then comprehend even a tithe of the wondrous process,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which goes on eternally within the confines of Caprona's barrier cliffs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nor am I any too sure that I do even now.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To-mar explained to So-al that it was I who had killed the cave-lion
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and saved her life, and that Ajor was my woman and thus entitled to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same loyalty which was my due.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first Ajor and So-al were like a couple of stranger cats on a back
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fence but soon they began to accept each other under something of an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: armed truce, and later became fast friends.  So-al was a mighty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fine-looking girl, built like a tigress as to strength and sinuosity,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but withal sweet and womanly.  Ajor and I came to be very fond of her,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and she was, I think, equally fond of us.  To-mar was very much of a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man--a savage, if you will, but none the less a man.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Finding that traveling in company with To-mar made our journey both
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: easier and safer, Ajor and I did not continue on our way alone while
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the novitiates delayed their approach to the Kro-lu country in order
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that they might properly fit themselves in the matter of arms and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparel, but remained with them.  Thus we became well acquainted--to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: such an extent that we looked forward with regret to the day when they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took their places among their new comrades and we should be forced to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: continue upon our way alone.  It was a matter of much concern to To-mar
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the Kro-lu would undoubtedly not receive Ajor and me in a friendly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manner, and that consequently we should have to avoid these people.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It would have been very helpful to us could we have made friends with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them, as their country abutted directly upon that of the Galus.  Their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friendship would have meant that Ajor's dangers were practically
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed, and that I had accomplished fully one-half of my long journey.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In view of what I had passed through, I often wondered what chance I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had to complete that journey in search of my friends.  The further
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south I should travel on the west side of the island, the more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful would the dangers become as I neared the stamping-grounds of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the more hideous reptilia and the haunts of the Alus and the Ho-lu, all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of which were at the southern half of the island; and then if I should
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not find the members of my party, what was to become of me?  I could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not live for long in any portion of Caspak with which I was familiar;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the moment my ammunition was exhausted, I should be as good as dead.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was a chance that the Galus would receive me; but even Ajor could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not say definitely whether they would or not, and even provided that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they would, could I retrace my steps from the beginning, after failing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to find my own people, and return to the far northern land of Galus?  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubted it.  However, I was learning from Ajor, who was more or less of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a fatalist, a philosophy which was as necessary in Caspak to peace of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind as is faith to the devout Christian of the outer world.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 5
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were sitting before a little fire inside a safe grotto one night
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shortly after we had quit the cliff-dwellings of the Band-lu, when
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So-al raised a question which it had never occurred to me to propound
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to Ajor.  She asked her why she had left her own people and how she had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come so far south as the country of the Alus, where I had found her.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first Ajor hesitated to explain; but at last she consented, and for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the first time I heard the complete story of her origin and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experiences.  For my benefit she entered into greater detail of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: explanation than would have been necessary had I been a native
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am a cos-ata-lo," commenced Ajor, and then she turned toward me.  "A
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cos-ata-lo, my Tom, is a woman" (lo) "who did not come from an egg and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thus on up from the beginning."  (Cor sva jo.)  "I was a babe at my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mother's breast.  Only among the Galus are such, and then but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: infrequently.  The Wieroo get most of us; but my mother hid me until I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had attained such size that the Wieroo could not readily distinguish me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from one who had come up from the beginning.  I knew both my mother and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my father, as only such as I may.  My father is high chief among the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galus.  His name is Jor, and both he and my mother came up from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beginning; but one of them, probably my mother, had completed the seven
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cycles" (approximately seven hundred years), "with the result that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their offspring might be cos-ata-lo, or born as are all the children of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your race, my Tom, as you tell me is the fact.  I was therefore apart
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from my fellows in that my children would probably be as I, of a higher
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: state of evolution, and so I was sought by the men of my people; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: none of them appealed to me.  I cared for none.  The most persistent
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was Du-seen, a huge warrior of whom my father stood in considerable
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear, since it was quite possible that Du-seen could wrest from him his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chieftainship of the Galus.  He has a large following of the newer
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galus, those most recently come up from the Kro-lu, and as this class
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is usually much more powerful numerically than the older Galus, and as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen's ambition knows no bounds, we have for a long time been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expecting him to find some excuse for a break with Jor the High Chief,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my father.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "A further complication lay in the fact that Du-seen wanted me, while I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have none of him, and then came evidence to my father's ears that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he was in league with the Wieroo; a hunter, returning late at night,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came trembling to my father, saying that he had seen Du-seen talking
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a Wieroo in a lonely spot far from the village, and that plainly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he had heard the words:  'If you will help me, I will help you--I will
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deliver into your hands all cos-ata-lo among the Galus, now and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hereafter; but for that service you must slay Jor the High Chief and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bring terror and confusion to his followers.'
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Now, when my father heard this, he was angry; but he was also
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: afraid--afraid for me, who am cos-ata-lo.  He called me to him and told
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me what he had heard, pointing out two ways in which we might frustrate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen.  The first was that I go to Du-seen as his mate, after which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he would be loath to give me into the hands of the Wieroo or to further
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abide by the wicked compact he had made--a compact which would doom his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own offspring, who would doubtless be as am I, their mother.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alternative was flight until Du-seen should have been overcome and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: punished.  I chose the latter and fled toward the south.  Beyond the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: confines of the Galu country is little danger from the Wieroo, who seek
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ordinarily only Galus of the highest orders.  There are two excellent
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reasons for this:  One is that from the beginning of time jealousy has
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: existed between the Wieroo and the Galus as to which would eventually
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dominate the world.  It seems generally conceded that that race which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first reaches a point of evolution which permits them to produce young
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their own species and of both sexes must dominate all other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creatures.  The Wieroo first began to produce their own kind--after
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which evolution from Galu to Wieroo ceased gradually until now it is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unknown; but the Wieroo produce only males--which is why they steal our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: female young, and by stealing cos-ata-lo they increase their own
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chances of eventually reproducing both sexes and at the same time
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lessen ours.  Already the Galus produce both male and female; but so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carefully do the Wieroo watch us that few of the males ever grow to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manhood, while even fewer are the females that are not stolen away.  It
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is indeed a strange condition, for while our greatest enemies hate and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear us, they dare not exterminate us, knowing that they too would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: become extinct but for us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ah, but could we once get a start, I am sure that when all were true
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cos-ata-lo there would have been evolved at last the true dominant race
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before which all the world would be forced to bow."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor always spoke of the world as though nothing existed beyond Caspak.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She could not seem to grasp the truth of my origin or the fact that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there were countless other peoples outside her stern barrier-cliffs.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She apparently felt that I came from an entirely different world.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Where it was and how I came to Caspak from it were matters quite beyond
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her with which she refused to trouble her pretty head.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Well," she continued, "and so I ran away to hide, intending to pass
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliffs to the south of Galu and find a retreat in the Kro-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country.  It would be dangerous, but there seemed no other way.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The third night I took refuge in a large cave in the cliffs at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: edge of my own country; upon the following day I would cross over into
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Kro-lu country, where I felt that I should be reasonably safe from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Wieroo, though menaced by countless other dangers.  However, to a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cos-ata-lo any fate is preferable to that of falling into the clutches
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the frightful Wieroo, from whose land none returns.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I had been sleeping peacefully for several hours when I was awakened
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by a slight noise within the cavern.  The moon was shining brightly,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: illumining the entrance, against which I saw silhouetted the dread
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure of a Wieroo.  There was no escape.  The cave was shallow, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entrance narrow.  I lay very still, hoping against hope, that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
