text: creature had but paused here to rest and might soon depart without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovering me; yet all the while I knew that he came seeking me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I waited, scarce breathing, watching the thing creep stealthily toward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, its great eyes luminous in the darkness of the cave's interior, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at last I knew that those eyes were directed upon me, for the Wieroo
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: can see in the darkness better than even the lion or the tiger.  But a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: few feet separated us when I sprang to my feet and dashed madly toward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my menacer in a vain effort to dodge past him and reach the outside
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world.  It was madness of course, for even had I succeeded temporarily,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Wieroo would have but followed and swooped down upon me from above.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As it was, he reached forth and seized me, and though I struggled, he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overpowered me.  In the duel his long, white robe was nearly torn from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him, and he became very angry, so that he trembled and beat his wings
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: together in his rage.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He asked me my name; but I would not answer him, and that angered him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still more.  At last he dragged me to the entrance of the cave, lifted
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me in his arms, spread his great wings and leaping into the air,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flapped dismally through the night.  I saw the moonlit landscape
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sliding away beneath me, and then we were out above the sea and on our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way to Oo-oh, the country of the Wieroo.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The dim outlines of Oo-oh were unfolding below us when there came from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above a loud whirring of giant wings.  The Wieroo and I glanced up
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simultaneously, to see a pair of huge jo-oos" (flying
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptiles--pterodactyls) "swooping down upon us.  The Wieroo wheeled and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dropped almost to sea-level, and then raced southward in an effort to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outdistance our pursuers.  The great creatures, notwithstanding their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enormous weight, are swift on their wings; but the Wieroo are swifter.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Even with my added weight, the creature that bore me maintained his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lead, though he could not increase it.  Faster than the fastest wind we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: raced through the night, southward along the coast.  Sometimes we rose
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to great heights, where the air was chill and the world below but a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blur of dim outlines; but always the jo-oos stuck behind us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I knew that we had covered a great distance, for the rush of the wind
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by my face attested the speed of our progress, but I had no idea where
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were when at last I realized that the Wieroo was weakening.  One of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the jo-oos gained on us and succeeded in heading us, so that my captor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had to turn in toward the coast.  Further and further they forced him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the left; lower and lower he sank.  More labored was his breathing,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and weaker the stroke of his once powerful wings.  We were not ten feet
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: above the ground when they overtook us, and at the edge of a forest.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One of them seized the Wieroo by his right wing, and in an effort to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: free himself, he loosed his grasp upon me, dropping me to earth.  Like
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a frightened ecca I leaped to my feet and raced for the sheltering
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sanctuary of the forest, where I knew neither could follow or seize me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Then I turned and looked back to see two great reptiles tear my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abductor asunder and devour him on the spot.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I was saved; yet I felt that I was lost.  How far I was from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country of the Galus I could not guess; nor did it seem probable that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever could make my way in safety to my native land.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Day was breaking; soon the carnivora would stalk forth for their first
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kill; I was armed only with my knife.  About me was a strange
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: landscape--the flowers, the trees, the grasses, even, were different
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from those of my northern world, and presently there appeared before me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a creature fully as hideous as the Wieroo--a hairy manthing that barely
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: walked erect.  I shuddered, and then I fled.  Through the hideous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangers that my forebears had endured in the earlier stages of their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: human evolution I fled; and always pursuing was the hairy monster that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had discovered me.  Later he was joined by others of his kind.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were the speechless men, the Alus, from whom you rescued me, my Tom.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From then on, you know the story of my adventures, and from the first,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I would endure them all again because they led me to you!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was very nice of her to say that, and I appreciated it.  I felt that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she was a mighty nice little girl whose friendship anyone might be glad
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to have; but I wished that when she touched me, those peculiar thrills
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would not run through me.  It was most discomforting, because it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reminded me of love; and I knew that I never could love this half-baked
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little barbarian.  I was very much interested in her account of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Wieroo, which up to this time I had considered a purely mythological
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature; but Ajor shuddered so at even the veriest mention of the name
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was loath to press the subject upon her, and so the Wieroo still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remained a mystery to me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: While the Wieroo interested me greatly, I had little time to think
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about them, as our waking hours were filled with the necessities of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: existence--the constant battle for survival which is the chief
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occupation of Caspakians.  To-mar and So-al were now about fitted for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their advent into Kro-lu society and must therefore leave us, as we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not accompany them without incurring great danger ourselves and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: running the chance of endangering them; but each swore to be always our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friend and assured us that should we need their aid at any time we had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but to ask it; nor could I doubt their sincerity, since we had been so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instrumental in bringing them safely upon their journey toward the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu village.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: This was our last day together.  In the afternoon we should separate,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To-mar and So-al going directly to the Kro-lu village, while Ajor and I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made a detour to avoid a conflict with the archers.  The former both
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: showed evidence of nervous apprehension as the time approached for them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to make their entry into the village of their new people, and yet both
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were very proud and happy.  They told us that they would be well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: received as additions to a tribe always are welcomed, and the more so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as the distance from the beginning increased, the higher tribes or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: races being far weaker numerically than the lower.  The southern end of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the island fairly swarms with the Ho-lu, or apes; next above these are
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Alus, who are slightly fewer in number than the Ho-lu; and again
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there are fewer Bo-lu than Alus, and fewer Sto-lu than Bo-lu.  Thus it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: goes until the Kro-lu are fewer in number than any of the others; and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here the law reverses, for the Galus outnumber the Kro-lu.  As Ajor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: explained it to me, the reason for this is that as evolution
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: practically ceases with the Galus, there is no less among them on this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: score, for even the cos-ata-lo are still considered Galus and remain
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with them.  And Galus come up both from the west and east coasts.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There are, too, fewer carnivorous reptiles at the north end of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: island, and not so many of the great and ferocious members of the cat
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: family as take their hideous toll of life among the races further south.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: By now I was obtaining some idea of the Caspakian scheme of evolution,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which partly accounted for the lack of young among the races I had so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far seen.  Coming up from the beginning, the Caspakian passes, during a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: single existence, through the various stages of evolution, or at least
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: many of them, through which the human race has passed during the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countless ages since life first stirred upon a new world; but the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: question which continued to puzzle me was: What creates life at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beginning, cor sva jo?
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had noticed that as we traveled northward from the Alus' country the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: land had gradually risen until we were now several hundred feet above
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the level of the inland sea.  Ajor told me that the Galus country was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still higher and considerably colder, which accounted for the scarcity
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of reptiles.  The change in form and kinds of the lower animals was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even more marked than the evolutionary stages of man.  The diminutive
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ecca, or small horse, became a rough-coated and sturdy little pony in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Kro-lu country.  I saw a greater number of small lions and tigers,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though many of the huge ones still persisted, while the woolly mammoth
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was more in evidence, as were several varieties of the Labyrinthadonta.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These creatures, from which God save me, I should have expected to find
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: further south; but for some unaccountable reason they gain their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greatest bulk in the Kro-lu and Galu countries, though fortunately they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are rare.  I rather imagine that they are a very early life which is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rapidly nearing extinction in Caspak, though wherever they are found,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they constitute a menace to all forms of life.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was mid-afternoon when To-mar and So-al bade us good-bye.  We were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not far from Kro-lu village; in fact, we had approached it much closer
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than we had intended, and now Ajor and I were to make a detour toward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sea while our companions went directly in search of the Kro-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chief.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor and I had gone perhaps a mile or two and were just about to emerge
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from a dense wood when I saw that ahead of us which caused me to draw
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back into concealment, at the same time pushing Ajor behind me.  What I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw was a party of Band-lu warriors--large, fierce-appearing men.  From
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the direction of their march I saw that they were returning to their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: caves, and that if we remained where we were, they would pass without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovering us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Presently Ajor nudged me.  "They have a prisoner," she whispered.  "He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is a Kro-lu."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then I saw him, the first fully developed Kro-lu I had seen.  He was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a fine-looking savage, tall and straight with a regal carriage.  To-mar
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a handsome fellow; but this Kro-lu showed plainly in his every
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: physical attribute a higher plane of evolution.  While To-mar was just
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entering the Kro-lu sphere, this man, it seemed to me, must be close
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indeed to the next stage of his development, which would see him an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: envied Galu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They will kill him?" I whispered to Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The dance of death," she replied, and I shuddered, so recently had I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escaped the same fate.  It seemed cruel that one who must have passed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: safely up through all the frightful stages of human evolution within
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, should die at the very foot of his goal.  I raised my rifle to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my shoulder and took careful aim at one of the Band-lu.  If I hit him,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I would hit two, for another was directly behind the first.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor touched my arm.  "What would you do?" she asked.  "They are all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our enemies."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am going to save him from the dance of death," I replied, "enemy or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no enemy," and I squeezed the trigger.  At the report, the two Band-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lunged forward upon their faces.  I handed my rifle to Ajor, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: drawing my pistol, stepped out in full view of the startled party.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu did not run away as had some of the lower orders of Caspakians
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at the sound of the rifle.  Instead, the moment they saw me, they let
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out a series of demoniac war-cries, and raising their spears above
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their heads, charged me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Kro-lu stood silent and statuesque, watching the proceedings.  He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made no attempt to escape, though his feet were not bound and none of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the warriors remained to guard him.  There were ten of the Band-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coming for me.  I dropped three of them with my pistol as rapidly as a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man might count by three, and then my rifle spoke close to my left
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulder, and another of them stumbled and rolled over and over upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ground.  Plucky little Ajor!  She had never fired a shot before in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all her life, though I had taught her to sight and aim and how to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: squeeze the trigger instead of pulling it.  She had practiced these new
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accomplishments often, but little had I thought they would make a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: marksman of her so quickly.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With six of their fellows put out of the fight so easily, the remaining
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: six sought cover behind some low bushes and commenced a council of war.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I wished that they would go away, as I had no ammunition to waste, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was fearful that should they institute another charge, some of them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would reach us, for they were already quite close.  Suddenly one of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them rose and launched his spear.  It was the most marvelous exhibition
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of speed I have ever witnessed.  It seemed to me that he had scarce
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gained an upright position when the weapon was half-way upon its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: journey, speeding like an arrow toward Ajor.  And then it was, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that little life in danger, that I made the best shot I have ever made
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in my life!  I took no conscious aim; it was as though my subconscious
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind, impelled by a stronger power even than that of self-preservation,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: directed my hand.  Ajor was in danger!  Simultaneously with the thought
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my pistol flew to position, a streak of incandescent powder marked the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: path of the bullet from its muzzle; and the spear, its point shattered,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was deflected from its path.  With a howl of dismay the six Band-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rose from their shelter and raced away toward the south.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I turned toward Ajor.  She was very white and wide-eyed, for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clutching fingers of death had all but seized her; but a little smile
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came to her lips and an expression of great pride to her eyes.  "My
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tom!" she said, and took my hand in hers.  That was all--"My Tom!" and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a pressure of the hand.  Her Tom!  Something stirred within my bosom.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Was it exaltation or was it consternation?  Impossible!  I turned away
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost brusquely.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come!" I said, and strode off toward the Kro-lu prisoner.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Kro-lu stood watching us with stolid indifference.  I presume that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he expected to be killed; but if he did, he showed no outward sign of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fear.  His eyes, indicating his greatest interest, were fixed upon my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pistol or the rifle which Ajor still carried.  I cut his bonds with my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knife.  As I did so, an expression of surprise tinged and animated the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: haughty reserve of his countenance.  He eyed me quizzically.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What are you going to do with me?" he asked.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are free," I replied.  "Go home, if you wish."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why don't you kill me?" he inquired.  "I am defenseless."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why should I kill you? I have risked my life and that of this young
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lady to save your life.  Why, therefore should I now take it?"  Of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: course, I didn't say "young lady" as there is no Caspakian equivalent
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for that term; but I have to allow myself considerable latitude in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: translation of Caspakian conversations.  To speak always of a beautiful
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: young girl as a "she" may be literal; but it seems far from gallant.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Kro-lu concentrated his steady, level gaze upon me for at least a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full minute.  Then he spoke again.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you, man of strange skins?" he asked.  "Your she is Galu; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you are neither Galu nor Kro-lu nor Band-lu, nor any other sort of man
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which I have seen before.  Tell me from whence comes so mighty a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warrior and so generous a foe."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is a long story," I replied, "but suffice it to say that I am not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Caspak.  I am a stranger here, and--let this sink in--I am not a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foe.  I have no wish to be an enemy of any man in Caspak, with the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possible exception of the Galu warrior Du-seen."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Du-seen!" he exclaimed.  "You are an enemy of Du-seen?  And why?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Because he would harm Ajor," I replied.  "You know him?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He cannot know him," said Ajor.  "Du-seen rose from the Kro-lu long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ago, taking a new name, as all do when they enter a new sphere.  He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cannot know him, as there is no intercourse between the Kro-lu and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The warrior smiled.  "Du-seen rose not so long ago," he said, "that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: do not recall him well, and recently he has taken it upon himself to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abrogate the ancient laws of Caspak; he had had intercourse with the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu.  Du-seen would be chief of the Galus, and he has come to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu for help."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor was aghast.  The thing was incredible.  Never had Kro-lu and Galu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had friendly relations; by the savage laws of Caspak they were deadly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enemies, for only so can the several races maintain their individuality.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Will the Kro-lu join him?" asked Ajor.  "Will they invade the country
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Jor my father?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The younger Kro-lu favor the plan," replied the warrior, "since they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: believe they will thus become Galus immediately.  They hope to span the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long years of change through which they must pass in the ordinary
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: course of events and at a single stride become Galus.  We of the older
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu tell them that though they occupy the land of the Galu and wear
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the skins and ornaments of the golden people, still they will not be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galus till the time arrives that they are ripe to rise.  We also tell
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them that even then they will never become a true Galu race, since
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there will still be those among them who can never rise.  It is all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right to raid the Galu country occasionally for plunder, as our people
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: do; but to attempt to conquer it and hold it is madness.  For my part,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I have been content to wait until the call came to me.  I feel that it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cannot now be long."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What is your name?" asked Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Chal-az," replied the man.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You are chief of the Kro-lu?" Ajor continued.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "No, it is Al-tan who is chief of the Kro-lu of the east," answered
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chal-az.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And he is against this plan to invade my father's country?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Unfortunately he is rather in favor of it," replied the man, "since he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: has about come to the conclusion that he is batu.  He has been chief
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever since, before I came up from the Band-lu, and I can see no change
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in him in all those years.  In fact, he still appears to be more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lu than Kro-lu.  However, he is a good chief and a mighty warrior,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and if Du-seen persuades him to his cause, the Galus may find
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves under a Kro-lu chieftain before long--Du-seen as well as the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: others, for Al-tan would never consent to occupy a subordinate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: position, and once he plants a victorious foot in Galu, he will not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: withdraw it without a struggle."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I asked them what batu meant, as I had not before heard the word.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Literally translated, it is equivalent to through, finished, done-for,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as applied to an individual's evolutionary progress in Caspak, and with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this information was developed the interesting fact that not every
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: individual is capable of rising through every stage to that of Galu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Some never progress beyond the Alu stage; others stop as Bo-lu, as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sto-lu, as Band-lu or as Kro-lu.  The Ho-lu of the first generation may
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rise to become Alus; the Alus of the second generation may become
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bo-lu, while it requires three generations of Bo-lu to become Band-lu,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and so on until Kro-lu's parent on one side must be of the sixth
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: generation.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was not entirely plain to me even with this explanation, since I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couldn't understand how there could be different generations of peoples
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who apparently had no offspring.  Yet I was commencing to get a slight
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glimmer of the strange laws which govern propagation and evolution in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this weird land.  Already I knew that the warm pools which always lie
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close to every tribal abiding-place were closely linked with the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian scheme of evolution, and that the daily immersion of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: females in the greenish slimy water was in response to some natural
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: law, since neither pleasure nor cleanliness could be derived from what
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed almost a religious rite.  Yet I was still at sea; nor,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemingly, could Ajor enlighten me, since she was compelled to use
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: words which I could not understand and which it was impossible for her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to explain the meanings of.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we stood talking, we were suddenly startled by a commotion in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bushes and among the boles of the trees surrounding us, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simultaneously a hundred Kro-lu warriors appeared in a rough circle
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about us.  They greeted Chal-az with a volley of questions as they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached slowly from all sides, their heavy bows fitted with long,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sharp arrows.  Upon Ajor and me they looked with covetousness in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one instance and suspicion in the other; but after they had heard
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chal-az's story, their attitude was more friendly.  A huge savage did
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all the talking.  He was a mountain of a man, yet perfectly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: proportioned.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "This is Al-tan the chief," said Chal-az by way of introduction.  Then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he told something of my story, and Al-tan asked me many questions of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the land from which I came.  The warriors crowded around close to hear
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my replies, and there were many expressions of incredulity as I spoke
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of what was to them another world, of the yacht which had brought me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over vast waters, and of the plane that had borne me Jo-oo-like over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the summit of the barrier-cliffs.  It was the mention of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hydroaeroplane which precipitated the first outspoken skepticism, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then Ajor came to my defense.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I saw it with my own eyes!" she exclaimed.  "I saw him flying through
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the air in battle with a Jo-oo.  The Alus were chasing me, and they saw
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ran away."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Whose is this she?" demanded Al-tan suddenly, his eyes fixed fiercely
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a moment there was silence.  Ajor looked up at me, a hurt and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: questioning expression on her face.  "Whose she is this?" repeated
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Al-tan.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "She is mine," I replied, though what force it was that impelled me to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: say it I could not have told; but an instant later I was glad that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had spoken the words, for the reward of Ajor's proud and happy face was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reward indeed.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Al-tan eyed her for several minutes and then turned to me.  "Can you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: keep her?" he asked, just the tinge of a sneer upon his face.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I laid my palm upon the grip of my pistol and answered that I could.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He saw the move, glanced at the butt of the automatic where it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: protruded from its holster, and smiled.  Then he turned and raising his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great bow, fitted an arrow and drew the shaft far back.  His warriors,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supercilious smiles upon their faces, stood silently watching him.  His
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bow was the longest and the heaviest among them all.  A mighty man
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indeed must he be to bend it; yet Al-tan drew the shaft back until the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stone point touched his left forefinger, and he did it with consummate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ease.  Then he raised the shaft to the level of his right eye, held it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there for an instant and released it.  When the arrow stopped, half its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: length protruded from the opposite side of a six-inch tree fifty feet
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away.  Al-tan and his warriors turned toward me with expressions of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immense satisfaction upon their faces, and then, apparently for Ajor's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: benefit, the chieftain swaggered to and fro a couple of times, swinging
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his great arms and his bulky shoulders for all the world like a drunken
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prize-fighter at a beach dancehall.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw that some reply was necessary, and so in a single motion, I drew
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my gun, dropped it on the still quivering arrow and pulled the trigger.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the sound of the report, the Kro-lu leaped back and raised their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons; but as I was smiling, they took heart and lowered them again,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: following my eyes to the tree; the shaft of their chief was gone, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the bole was a little round hole marking the path of my bullet.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a good shot if I do say it myself, "as shouldn't" but necessity
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must have guided that bullet; I simply had to make a good shot, that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might immediately establish my position among those savage and warlike
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakians of the sixth sphere.  That it had its effect was immediately
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noticeable, but I am none too sure that it helped my cause with Al-tan.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whereas he might have condescended to tolerate me as a harmless and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: interesting curiosity, he now, by the change in his expression,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared to consider me in a new and unfavorable light.  Nor can I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wonder, knowing this type as I did, for had I not made him ridiculous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the eyes of his warriors, beating him at his own game?  What king,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage or civilized, could condone such impudence?  Seeing his black
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scowls, I deemed it expedient, especially on Ajor's account, to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terminate the interview and continue upon our way; but when I would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have done so, Al-tan detained us with a gesture, and his warriors
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pressed around us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What is the meaning of this?" I demanded, and before Al-tan could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reply, Chal-az raised his voice in our behalf.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Is this the gratitude of a Kro-lu chieftain, Al-tan," he asked, "to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one who has served you by saving one of your warriors from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enemy--saving him from the death dance of the Band-lu?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Al-tan was silent for a moment, and then his brow cleared, and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: faint imitation of a pleasant expression struggled for existence as he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: said:  "The stranger will not be harmed.  I wished only to detain him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that he may be feasted tonight in the village of Al-tan the Kro-lu.  In
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the morning he may go his way.  Al-tan will not hinder him."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was not entirely reassured; but I wanted to see the interior of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu village, and anyway I knew that if Al-tan intended treachery I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would be no more in his power in the morning than I now was--in fact,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: during the night I might find opportunity to escape with Ajor, while at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the instant neither of us could hope to escape unscathed from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: encircling warriors.  Therefore, in order to disarm him of any thought
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I might entertain suspicion as to his sincerity, I promptly and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: courteously accepted his invitation.  His satisfaction was evident, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as we set off toward his village, he walked beside me, asking many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: questions as to the country from which I came, its peoples and their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: customs.  He seemed much mystified by the fact that we could walk
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abroad by day or night without fear of being devoured by wild beasts or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage reptiles, and when I told him of the great armies which we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: maintained, his simple mind could not grasp the fact that they existed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: solely for the slaughtering of human beings.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am glad," he said, "that I do not dwell in your country among such
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savage peoples.  Here, in Caspak, men fight with men when they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meet--men of different races--but their weapons are first for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slaying of beasts in the chase and in defense.  We do not fashion
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons solely for the killing of man as do your peoples.  Your country
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must indeed be a savage country, from which you are fortunate to have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escaped to the peace and security of Caspak."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here was a new and refreshing viewpoint; nor could I take exception to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it after what I had told Al-tan of the great war which had been raging
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in Europe for over two years before I left home.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the march to the Kro-lu village we were continually stalked by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: innumerable beasts of prey, and three times we were attacked by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful creatures; but Al-tan took it all as a matter of course,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rushing forward with raised spear or sending a heavy shaft into the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: body of the attacker and then returning to our conversation as though
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no interruption had occurred.  Twice were members of his band mauled,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and one was killed by a huge and bellicose rhinoceros; but the instant
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the action was over, it was as though it never had occurred.  The dead
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man was stripped of his belongings and left where he had died; the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carnivora would take care of his burial.  The trophies that these
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu left to the meat-eaters would have turned an English big-game
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hunter green with envy.  They did, it is true, cut all the edible parts
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the rhino and carry them home; but already they were pretty well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weighted down with the spoils of the chase, and only the fact that they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are particularly fond of rhino-meat caused them to do so.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They left the hide on the pieces they selected, as they use it for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sandals, shield-covers, the hilts of their knives and various other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: purposes where tough hide is desirable.  I was much interested in their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shields, especially after I saw one used in defense against the attack
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a saber-tooth tiger.  The huge creature had charged us without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warning from a clump of dense bushes where it was lying up after
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eating.  It was met with an avalanche of spears, some of which passed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entirely through its body, with such force were they hurled.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: charge was from a very short distance, requiring the use of the spear
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather than the bow and arrow; but after the launching of the spears,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the men not directly in the path of the charge sent bolt after bolt
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the great carcass with almost incredible rapidity.  The beast,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: screaming with pain and rage, bore down upon Chal-az while I stood
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: helpless with my rifle for fear of hitting one of the warriors who were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closing in upon it.  But Chal-az was ready.  Throwing aside his bow, he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crouched behind his large oval shield, in the center of which was a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hole about six inches in diameter.  The shield was held by tight loops
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to his left arm, while in his right hand he grasped his heavy knife.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bristling with spears and arrows, the great cat hurled itself upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shield, and down went Chal-az upon his back with the shield entirely
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: covering him.  The tiger clawed and bit at the heavy rhinoceros hide
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with which the shield was faced, while Chal-az, through the round hole
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the shield's center, plunged his blade repeatedly into the vitals of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the savage animal.  Doubtless the battle would have gone to Chal-az
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even though I had not interfered; but the moment that I saw a clean
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opening, with no Kro-lu beyond, I raised my rifle and killed the beast.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When Chal-az arose, he glanced at the sky and remarked that it looked
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: like rain.  The others already had resumed the march toward the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village.  The incident was closed.  For some unaccountable reason the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whole thing reminded me of a friend who once shot a cat in his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: backyard.  For three weeks he talked of nothing else.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was almost dark when we reached the village--a large palisaded
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enclosure of several hundred leaf-thatched huts set in groups of from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: two to seven.  The huts were hexagonal in form, and where grouped were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: joined so that they resembled the cells of a bee-hive.  One hut meant a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warrior and his mate, and each additional hut in a group indicated an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: additional female.  The palisade which surrounded the village was of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: logs set close together and woven into a solid wall with tough creepers
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which were planted at their base and trained to weave in and out to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bind the logs together.  The logs slanted outward at an angle of about
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thirty degrees, in which position they were held by shorter logs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: embedded in the ground at right angles to them and with their upper
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ends supporting the longer pieces a trifle above their centers of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equilibrium.  Along the top of the palisade sharpened stakes had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: driven at all sorts of angles.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The only opening into the inclosure was through a small aperture three
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet wide and three feet high, which was closed from the inside by logs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about six feet long laid horizontally, one upon another, between the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inside face of the palisade and two other braced logs which paralleled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the face of the wall upon the inside.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we entered the village, we were greeted by a not unfriendly crowd of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: curious warriors and women, to whom Chal-az generously explained the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: service we had rendered him, whereupon they showered us with the most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well-meant attentions, for Chal-az, it seemed, was a most popular
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: member of the tribe.  Necklaces of lion- and tiger-teeth, bits of dried
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meat, finely tanned hides and earthen pots, beautifully decorated, they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thrust upon us until we were loaded down, and all the while Al-tan
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glared balefully upon us, seemingly jealous of the attentions heaped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon us because we had served Chal-az.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last we reached a hut that they set apart for us, and there we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cooked our meat and some vegetables the women brought us, and had milk
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from cows--the first I had had in Caspak--and cheese from the milk of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wild goats, with honey and thin bread made from wheat flour of their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own grinding, and grapes and the fermented juice of grapes.  It was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite the most wonderful meal I had eaten since I quit the _Toreador_ and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen J.  Tyler's colored chef, who could make pork-chops taste like
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chicken, and chicken taste like heaven.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 6
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After dinner I rolled a cigaret and stretched myself at ease upon a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pile of furs before the doorway, with Ajor's head pillowed in my lap
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and a feeling of great content pervading me.  It was the first time
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since my plane had topped the barrier-cliffs of Caspak that I had felt
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any sense of peace or security.  My hand wandered to the velvet cheek
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the girl I had claimed as mine, and to her luxuriant hair and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: golden fillet which bound it close to her shapely head.  Her slender
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fingers groping upward sought mine and drew them to her lips, and then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I gathered her in my arms and crushed her to me, smothering her mouth
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a long, long kiss.  It was the first time that passion had tinged
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my intercourse with Ajor.  We were alone, and the hut was ours until
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: morning.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But now from beyond the palisade in the direction of the main gate came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hallooing of men and the answering calls and queries of the guard.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We listened.  Returning hunters, no doubt.  We heard them enter the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village amidst the barking dogs.  I have forgotten to mention the dogs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Kro-lu.  The village swarmed with them, gaunt, wolflike creatures
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that guarded the herd by day when it grazed without the palisade, ten
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dogs to a cow.  By night the cows were herded in an outer inclosure
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roofed against the onslaughts of the carnivorous cats; and the dogs,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the exception of a few, were brought into the village; these few
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well-tested brutes remained with the herd.  During the day they fed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plentifully upon the beasts of prey which they killed in protection of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the herd, so that their keep amounted to nothing at all.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shortly after the commotion at the gate had subsided, Ajor and I arose
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to enter the hut, and at the same time a warrior appeared from one of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the twisted alleys which, lying between the irregularly placed huts and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: groups of huts, form the streets of the Kro-lu village.  The fellow
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: halted before us and addressed me, saying that Al-tan desired my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presence at his hut.  The wording of the invitation and the manner of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the messenger threw me entirely off my guard, so cordial was the one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and respectful the other, and the result was that I went willingly,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: telling Ajor that I would return presently.  I had laid my arms and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition aside as soon as we had taken over the hut, and I left them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with Ajor now, as I had noticed that aside from their hunting-knives
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the men of Kro-lu bore no weapons about the village streets.  There was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an atmosphere of peace and security within that village that I had not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hoped to experience within Caspak, and after what I had passed through,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it must have cast a numbing spell over my faculties of judgment and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reason.  I had eaten of the lotus-flower of safety; dangers no longer
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threatened for they had ceased to be.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The messenger led me through the labyrinthine alleys to an open plaza
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: near the center of the village.  At one end of this plaza was a long
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hut, much the largest that I had yet seen, before the door of which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were many warriors.  I could see that the interior was lighted and that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a great number of men were gathered within.  The dogs about the plaza
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were as thick as fleas, and those I approached closely evinced a strong
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desire to devour me, their noses evidently apprising them of the fact
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was of an alien race, since they paid no attention whatever to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my companion.  Once inside the council-hut, for such it appeared to be,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I found a large concourse of warriors seated, or rather squatted,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: around the floor.  At one end of the oval space which the warriors left
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down the center of the room stood Al-tan and another warrior whom I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediately recognized as a Galu, and then I saw that there were many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galus present.  About the walls were a number of flaming torches stuck
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in holes in a clay plaster which evidently served the purpose of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: preventing the inflammable wood and grasses of which the hut was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: composed from being ignited by the flames.  Lying about among the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors or wandering restlessly to and fro were a number of savage
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dogs.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The warriors eyed me curiously as I entered, especially the Galus, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then I was conducted into the center of the group and led forward
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward Al-tan.  As I advanced I felt one of the dogs sniffing at my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heels, and of a sudden a great brute leaped upon my back.  As I turned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to thrust it aside before its fangs found a hold upon me, I beheld a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: huge Airedale leaping frantically about me.  The grinning jaws, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: half-closed eyes, the back-laid ears spoke to me louder than might the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: words of man that here was no savage enemy but a joyous friend, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then I recognized him, and fell to one knee and put my arms about his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neck while he whined and cried with joy.  It was Nobs, dear old Nobs.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen Tyler's Nobs, who had loved me next to his master.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Where is the master of this dog?" I asked, turning toward Al-tan.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The chieftain inclined his head toward the Galu standing at his side.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He belongs to Du-seen the Galu," he replied.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He belongs to Bowen J. Tyler, Jr., of Santa Monica," I retorted, "and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I want to know where his master is."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Galu shrugged.  "The dog is mine," he said.  "He came to me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cor-sva-jo, and he is unlike any dog in Caspak, being kind and docile
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and yet a killer when aroused.  I would not part with him.  I do not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: know the man of whom you speak."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So this was Du-seen!  This was the man from whom Ajor had fled.  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wondered if he knew that she was here.  I wondered if they had sent for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me because of her; but after they had commenced to question me, my mind
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was relieved; they did not mention Ajor.  Their interest seemed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: centered upon the strange world from which I had come, my journey to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak and my intentions now that I had arrived.  I answered them
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frankly as I had nothing to conceal and assured them that my only wish
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was to find my friends and return to my own country.  In the Galu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen and his warriors I saw something of the explanation of the term
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "golden race" which is applied to them, for their ornaments and weapons
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were either wholly of beaten gold or heavily decorated with the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: precious metal.  They were a very imposing set of men--tall and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: straight and handsome.  About their heads were bands of gold like that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which Ajor wore, and from their left shoulders depended the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leopard-tails of the Galus.  In addition to the deer-skin tunic which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: constituted the major portion of their apparel, each carried a light
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blanket of barbaric yet beautiful design--the first evidence of weaving
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had seen in Caspak.  Ajor had had no blanket, having lost it during
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her flight from the attentions of Du-seen; nor was she so heavily
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: incrusted with gold as these male members of her tribe.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The audience must have lasted fully an hour when Al-tan signified that
title: The People That Time Forgot
