author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I might return to my hut.  All the time Nobs had lain quietly at my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet; but the instant that I turned to leave, he was up and after me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen called to him; but the terrier never even so much as looked in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his direction.  I had almost reached the doorway leading from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: council-hall when Al-tan rose and called after me.  "Stop!" he shouted.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Stop, stranger! The beast of Du-seen the Galu follows you."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The dog is not Du-seen's," I replied.  "He belongs to my friend, as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: told you, and he prefers to stay with me until his master is found."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And I turned again to resume my way.  I had taken but a few steps when
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I heard a commotion behind me, and at the same moment a man leaned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close and whispered "Kazar!" close to my ear--kazar, the Caspakian
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equivalent of beware.  It was To-mar.  As he spoke, he turned quickly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away as though loath to have others see that he knew me, and at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same instant I wheeled to discover Du-seen striding rapidly after me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Al-tan followed him, and it was evident that both were angry.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen, a weapon half drawn, approached truculently.  "The beast is
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mine," he reiterated.  "Would you steal him?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He is not yours nor mine," I replied, "and I am not stealing him.  If
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he wishes to follow you, he may; I will not interfere; but if he wishes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to follow me, he shall; nor shall you prevent." I turned to Al-tan.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Is not that fair?" I demanded.  "Let the dog choose his master."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen, without waiting for Al-tan's reply, reached for Nobs and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasped him by the scruff of the neck.  I did not interfere, for I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guessed what would happen; and it did.  With a savage growl Nobs turned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: like lightning upon the Galu, wrenched loose from his hold and leaped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for his throat.  The man stepped back and warded off the first attack
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a heavy blow of his fist, immediately drawing his knife with which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to meet the Airedale's return.  And Nobs would have returned, all
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right, had not I spoken to him.  In a low voice I called him to heel.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For just an instant he hesitated, standing there trembling and with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bared fangs, glaring at his foe; but he was well trained and had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out with me quite as much as he had with Bowen--in fact, I had had most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to do with his early training; then he walked slowly and very
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stiff-legged to his place behind me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen, red with rage, would have had it out with the two of us had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not Al-tan drawn him to one side and whispered in his ear--upon which,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with a grunt, the Galu walked straight back to the opposite end of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hall, while Nobs and I continued upon our way toward the hut and Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we passed out into the village plaza, I saw Chal-az--we were so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close to one another that I could have reached out and touched him--and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our eyes met; but though I greeted him pleasantly and paused to speak
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to him, he brushed past me without a sign of recognition.  I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: puzzled at his behavior, and then I recalled that To-mar, though he had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warned me, had appeared not to wish to seem friendly with me.  I could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not understand their attitude, and was trying to puzzle out some sort
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of explanation, when the matter was suddenly driven from my mind by the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: report of a firearm.  Instantly I broke into a run, my brain in a whirl
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of forebodings, for the only firearms in the Kro-lu country were those
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had left in the hut with Ajor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That she was in danger I could not but fear, as she was now something
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of an adept in the handling of both the pistol and rifle, a fact which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: largely eliminated the chance that the shot had come from an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accidentally discharged firearm.  When I left the hut, I had felt that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she and I were safe among friends; no thought of danger was in my mind;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but since my audience with Al-tan, the presence and bearing of Du-seen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the strange attitude of both To-mar and Chal-az had each
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contributed toward arousing my suspicions, and now I ran along the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: narrow, winding alleys of the Kro-lu village with my heart fairly in my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mouth.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am endowed with an excellent sense of direction, which has been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greatly perfected by the years I have spent in the mountains and upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the plains and deserts of my native state, so that it was with little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or no difficulty that I found my way back to the hut in which I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: left Ajor.  As I entered the doorway, I called her name aloud.  There
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was no response.  I drew a box of matches from my pocket and struck a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: light and as the flame flared up, a half-dozen brawny warriors leaped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon me from as many directions; but even in the brief instant that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flare lasted, I saw that Ajor was not within the hut, and that my arms
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ammunition had been removed.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the six men leaped upon me, an angry growl burst from behind them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had forgotten Nobs.  Like a demon of hate he sprang among those
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu fighting-men, tearing, rending, ripping with his long tusks and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his mighty jaws.  They had me down in an instant, and it goes without
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saying that the six of them could have kept me there had it not been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for Nobs; but while I was struggling to throw them off, Nobs was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: springing first upon one and then upon another of them until they were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so put to it to preserve their hides and their lives from him that they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could give me only a small part of their attention.  One of them was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assiduously attempting to strike me on the head with his stone hatchet;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but I caught his arm and at the same time turned over upon my belly,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after which it took but an instant to get my feet under me and rise
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I did so, I kept a grip upon the man's arm, carrying it over one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulder.  Then I leaned suddenly forward and hurled my antagonist over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my head to a hasty fall at the opposite side of the hut.  In the dim
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: light of the interior I saw that Nobs had already accounted for one of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the others--one who lay very quiet upon the floor--while the four
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remaining upon their feet were striking at him with knives and hatchets.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Running to one side of the man I had just put out of the fighting, I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seized his hatchet and knife, and in another moment was in the thick of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the argument.  I was no match for these savage warriors with their own
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons and would soon have gone down to ignominious defeat and death
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had it not been for Nobs, who alone was a match for the four of them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I never saw any creature so quick upon its feet as was that great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Airedale, nor such frightful ferocity as he manifested in his attacks.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was as much the latter as the former which contributed to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: undoing of our enemies, who, accustomed though they were to the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ferocity of terrible creatures, seemed awed by the sight of this
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange beast from another world battling at the side of his equally
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange master.  Yet they were no cowards, and only by teamwork did
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs and I overcome them at last.  We would rush for a man,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simultaneously, and as Nobs leaped for him upon one side, I would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strike at his head with the stone hatchet from the other.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As the last man went down, I heard the running of many feet approaching
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us from the direction of the plaza.  To be captured now would mean
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death; yet I could not attempt to leave the village without first
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ascertaining the whereabouts of Ajor and releasing her if she were held
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a captive.  That I could escape the village I was not at all sure; but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of one thing I was positive; that it would do neither Ajor nor myself
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any service to remain where I was and be captured; so with Nobs, bloody
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but happy, following at heel, I turned down the first alley and slunk
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away in the direction of the northern end of the village.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Friendless and alone, hunted through the dark labyrinths of this savage
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: community, I seldom have felt more helpless than at that moment; yet
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far transcending any fear which I may have felt for my own safety was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my concern for that of Ajor.  What fate had befallen her?  Where was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she, and in whose power?  That I should live to learn the answers to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these queries I doubted; but that I should face death gladly in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attempt--of that I was certain.  And why?  With all my concern for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: welfare of my friends who had accompanied me to Caprona, and of my best
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friend of all, Bowen J. Tyler, Jr., I never yet had experienced the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost paralyzing fear for the safety of any other creature which now
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threw me alternately into a fever of despair and into a cold sweat of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apprehension as my mind dwelt upon the fate on one bit of half-savage
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: femininity of whose very existence even I had not dreamed a few short
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weeks before.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What was this hold she had upon me?  Was I bewitched, that my mind
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: refused to function sanely, and that judgment and reason were dethroned
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by some mad sentiment which I steadfastly refused to believe was love?
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had never been in love.  I was not in love now--the very thought was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: preposterous.  How could I, Thomas Billings, the right-hand man of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: late Bowen J.  Tyler, Sr., one of America's foremost captains of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: industry and the greatest man in California, be in love with a--a--the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: word stuck in my throat; yet by my own American standards Ajor could be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nothing else; at home, for all her beauty, for all her delicately
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tinted skin, little Ajor by her apparel, by the habits and customs and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manners of her people, by her life, would have been classed a squaw.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tom Billings in love with a squaw! I shuddered at the thought.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then there came to my mind, in a sudden, brilliant flash upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: screen of recollection the picture of Ajor as I had last seen her, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I lived again the delicious moment in which we had clung to one
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another, lips smothering lips, as I left her to go to the council hall
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Al-tan; and I could have kicked myself for the snob and the cad that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my thoughts had proven me--me, who had always prided myself that I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neither the one nor the other!
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These things ran through my mind as Nobs and I made our way through the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dark village, the voices and footsteps of those who sought us still in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our ears.  These and many other things, nor could I escape the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: incontrovertible fact that the little figure round which my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recollections and my hopes entwined themselves was that of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor--beloved barbarian!  My reveries were broken in upon by a hoarse
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whisper from the black interior of a hut past which we were making our
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way.  My name was called in a low voice, and a man stepped out beside
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me as I halted with raised knife.  It was Chal-az.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Quick!" he warned.  "In here!  It is my hut, and they will not search
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I hesitated, recalled his attitude of a few minutes before; and as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though he had read my thoughts, he said quickly:  "I could not speak to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you in the plaza without danger of arousing suspicions which would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prevent me aiding you later, for word had gone out that Al-tan had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned against you and would destroy you--this was after Du-seen the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu arrived."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I followed him into the hut, and with Nobs at our heels we passed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through several chambers into a remote and windowless apartment where a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small lamp sputtered in its unequal battle with the inky darkness.  A
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hole in the roof permitted the smoke from burning oil egress; yet the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: atmosphere was far from lucid.  Here Chal-az motioned me to a seat upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a furry hide spread upon the earthen floor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am your friend," he said.  "You saved my life; and I am no ingrate
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as is the batu Al-tan.  I will serve you, and there are others here who
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will serve you against Al-tan and this renegade Galu, Du-seen."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But where is Ajor?" I asked, for I cared little for my own safety
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while she was in danger.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Ajor is safe, too," he answered.  "We learned the designs of Al-tan
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Du-seen.  The latter, learning that Ajor was here, demanded her;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Al-tan promised that he should have her; but when the warriors went
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to get her To-mar went with them.  Ajor tried to defend herself.  She
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: killed one of the warriors, and then To-mar picked her up in his arms
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when the others had taken her weapons from her.  He told the others to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: look after the wounded man, who was really already dead, and to seize
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you upon your return, and that he, To-mar, would bear Ajor to Al-tan;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but instead of bearing her to Al-tan, he took her to his own hut, where
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she now is with So-al, To-mar's she.  It all happened very quickly.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To-mar and I were in the council-hut when Du-seen attempted to take the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dog from you.  I was seeking To-mar for this work.  He ran out
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediately and accompanied the warriors to your hut while I remained
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to watch what went on within the council-hut and to aid you if you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: needed aid.  What has happened since you know."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I thanked him for his loyalty and then asked him to take me to Ajor;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but he said that it could not be done, as the village streets were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: filled with searchers.  In fact, we could hear them passing to and fro
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among the huts, making inquiries, and at last Chal-az thought it best
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to go to the doorway of his dwelling, which consisted of many huts
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: joined together, lest they enter and search.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chal-az was absent for a long time--several hours which seemed an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eternity to me.  All sounds of pursuit had long since ceased, and I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: becoming uneasy because of his protracted absence when I heard him
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returning through the other apartments of his dwelling.  He was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perturbed when he entered that in which I awaited him, and I saw a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worried expression upon his face.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What is wrong?" I asked.  "Have they found Ajor?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "No," he replied; "but Ajor has gone.  She learned that you had escaped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them and was told that you had left the village, believing that she had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escaped too.  So-al could not detain her.  She made her way out over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the top of the palisade, armed with only her knife."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then I must go," I said, rising.  Nobs rose and shook himself.  He had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been dead asleep when I spoke.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," agreed Chal-az, "you must go at once.  It is almost dawn.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen leaves at daylight to search for her." He leaned close to my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ear and whispered:  "There are many to follow and help you.  Al-tan has
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agreed to aid Du-seen against the Galus of Jor; but there are many of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us who have combined to rise against Al-tan and prevent this ruthless
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desecration of the laws and customs of the Kro-lu and of Caspak.  We
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will rise as Luata has ordained that we shall rise, and only thus.  No
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: batu may win to the estate of a Galu by treachery and force of arms
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while Chal-az lives and may wield a heavy blow and a sharp spear with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: true Kro-lus at his back!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I hope that I may live to aid you," I replied.  "If I had my weapons
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and my ammunition, I could do much.  Do you know where they are?" "No,"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he said, "they have disappeared."  And then:  "Wait!  You cannot go
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forth half armed, and garbed as you are.  You are going into the Galu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country, and you must go as a Galu.  Come!"  And without waiting for a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reply, he led me into another apartment, or to be more explicit,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another of the several huts which formed his cellular dwelling.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here was a pile of skins, weapons, and ornaments.  "Remove your strange
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparel," said Chal-az, "and I will fit you out as a true Galu.  I have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slain several of them in the raids of my early days as a Kro-lu, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here are their trappings."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw the wisdom of his suggestion, and as my clothes were by now so
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ragged as to but half conceal my nakedness, I had no regrets in laying
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them aside.  Stripped to the skin, I donned the red-deerskin tunic, the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leopard-tail, the golden fillet, armlets and leg-ornaments of a Galu,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the belt, scabbard and knife, the shield, spear, bow and arrow and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the long rope which I learned now for the first time is the distinctive
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapon of the Galu warrior.  It is a rawhide rope, not dissimilar to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: those of the Western plains and cow-camps of my youth.  The honda is a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: golden oval and accurate weight for the throwing of the noose.  This
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heavy honda, Chal-az explained, is used as a weapon, being thrown with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great force and accuracy at an enemy and then coiled in for another
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cast.  In hunting and in battle, they use both the noose and the honda.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: If several warriors surround a single foeman or quarry, they rope it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with the noose from several sides; but a single warrior against a lone
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: antagonist will attempt to brain his foe with the metal oval.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could not have been more pleased with any weapon, short of a rifle,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which he could have found for me, since I have been adept with the rope
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from early childhood; but I must confess that I was less favorably
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inclined toward my apparel.  In so far as the sensation was concerned,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I might as well have been entirely naked, so short and light was the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tunic.  When I asked Chal-az for the Caspakian name for rope, he told
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me ga, and for the first time I understood the derivation of the word
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu, which means ropeman.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Entirely outfitted I would not have known myself, so strange was my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: garb and my armament.  Upon my back were slung my bow, arrows, shield,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and short spear; from the center of my girdle depended my knife; at my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right hip was my stone hatchet; and at my left hung the coils of my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long rope.  By reaching my right hand over my left shoulder, I could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seize the spear or arrows; my left hand could find my bow over my right
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulder, while a veritable contortionist-act was necessary to place my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shield in front of me and upon my left arm.  The shield, long and oval,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is utilized more as back-armor than as a defense against frontal
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attack, for the close-set armlets of gold upon the left forearm are
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: principally depended upon to ward off knife, spear, hatchet, or arrow
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from in front; but against the greater carnivora and the attacks of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several human antagonists, the shield is utilized to its best advantage
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and carried by loops upon the left arm.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Fully equipped, except for a blanket, I followed Chal-az from his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: domicile into the dark and deserted alleys of Kro-lu.  Silently we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crept along, Nobs silent at heel, toward the nearest portion of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: palisade.  Here Chal-az bade me farewell, telling me that he hoped to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see me soon among the Galus, as he felt that "the call soon would come"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to him.  I thanked him for his loyal assistance and promised that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whether I reached the Galu country or not, I should always stand ready
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to repay his kindness to me, and that he could count on me in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: revolution against Al-tan.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 7
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To run up the inclined surface of the palisade and drop to the ground
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outside was the work of but a moment, or would have been but for Nobs.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had to put my rope about him after we reached the top, lift him over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sharpened stakes and lower him upon the outside.  To find Ajor in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the unknown country to the north seemed rather hopeless; yet I could do
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no less than try, praying in the meanwhile that she would come through
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unscathed and in safety to her father.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As Nobs and I swung along in the growing light of the coming day, I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: impressed by the lessening numbers of savage beasts the farther north I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: traveled.  With the decrease among the carnivora, the herbivora
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: increased in quantity, though anywhere in Caspak they are sufficiently
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plentiful to furnish ample food for the meateaters of each locality.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The wild cattle, antelope, deer, and horses I passed showed changes in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evolution from their cousins farther south.  The kine were smaller and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less shaggy, the horses larger.  North of the Kro-lu village I saw a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small band of the latter of about the size of those of our old Western
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plains--such as the Indians bred in former days and to a lesser extent
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even now.  They were fat and sleek, and I looked upon them with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: covetous eyes and with thoughts that any old cow-puncher may well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine I might entertain after having hoofed it for weeks; but they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were wary, scarce permitting me to approach within bow-and-arrow range,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: much less within roping-distance; yet I still had hopes which I never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discarded.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Twice before noon we were stalked and charged by man-eaters; but even
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though I was without firearms, I still had ample protection in Nobs,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who evidently had learned something of Caspakian hunt rules under the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tutelage of Du-seen or some other Galu, and of course a great deal more
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by experience.  He always was on the alert for dangerous foes,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: invariably warning me by low growls of the approach of a large
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carnivorous animal long before I could either see or hear it, and then
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when the thing appeared, he would run snapping at its heels, drawing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the charge away from me until I found safety in some tree; yet never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did the wily Nobs take an unnecessary chance of a mauling.  He would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dart in and away so quickly that not even the lightning-like movements
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the great cats could reach him.  I have seen him tantalize them thus
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until they fairly screamed in rage.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The greatest inconvenience the hunters caused me was the delay, for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they have a nasty habit of keeping one treed for an hour or more if
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: balked in their designs; but at last we came in sight of a line of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs running east and west across our path as far as the eye could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see in either direction, and I knew that we reached the natural
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boundary which marks the line between the Kro-lu and Galu countries.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The southern face of these cliffs loomed high and forbidding, rising to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an altitude of some two hundred feet, sheer and precipitous, without a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: break that the eye could perceive.  How I was to find a crossing I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not guess.  Whether to search to the east toward the still
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loftier barrier-cliffs fronting upon the ocean, or westward in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: direction of the inland sea was a question which baffled me.  Were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there many passes or only one?  I had no way of knowing.  I could but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trust to chance.  It never occurred to me that Nobs had made the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crossing at least once, possibly a greater number of times, and that he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might lead me to the pass; and so it was with no idea of assistance
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I appealed to him as a man alone with a dumb brute so often does.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Nobs," I said, "how the devil are we going to cross those cliffs?"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I do not say that he understood me, even though I realize that an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Airedale is a mighty intelligent dog; but I do swear that he seemed to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understand me, for he wheeled about, barking joyously and trotted off
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the west; and when I didn't follow him, he ran back to me
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barking furiously, and at last taking hold of the calf of my leg in an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: effort to pull me along in the direction he wished me to go.  Now, as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my legs were naked and Nobs' jaws are much more powerful than he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realizes, I gave in and followed him, for I knew that I might as well
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go west as east, as far as any knowledge I had of the correct direction
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: went.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We followed the base of the cliffs for a considerable distance.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ground was rolling and tree-dotted and covered with grazing animals,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alone, in pairs and in herds--a motley aggregation of the modern and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extinct herbivora of the world.  A huge woolly mastodon stood swaying
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to and fro in the shade of a giant fern--a mighty bull with enormous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upcurving tusks.  Near him grazed an aurochs bull with a cow and a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: calf, close beside a lone rhinoceros asleep in a dust-hole.  Deer,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: antelope, bison, horses, sheep, and goats were all in sight at the same
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time, and at a little distance a great megatherium reared up on its
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: huge tail and massive hind feet to tear the leaves from a tall tree.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The forgotten past rubbed flanks with the present--while Tom Billings,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: modern of the moderns, passed in the garb of pre-Glacial man, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before him trotted a creature of a breed scarce sixty years old.  Nobs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a parvenu; but it failed to worry him.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we neared the inland sea we saw more flying reptiles and several
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great amphibians, but none of them attacked us.  As we were topping a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rise in the middle of the afternoon, I saw something that brought me to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a sudden stop.  Calling Nobs in a whisper, I cautioned him to silence
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and kept him at heel while I threw myself flat and watched, from behind
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a sheltering shrub, a body of warriors approaching the cliff from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south.  I could see that they were Galus, and I guessed that Du-seen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: led them.  They had taken a shorter route to the pass and so had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overhauled me.  I could see them plainly, for they were no great
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distance away, and saw with relief that Ajor was not with them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The cliffs before them were broken and ragged, those coming from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: east overlapping the cliffs from the west.  Into the defile formed by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this overlapping the party filed.  I could see them climbing upward for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a few minutes, and then they disappeared from view.  When the last of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them had passed from sight, I rose and bent my steps in the direction
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the pass--the same pass toward which Nobs had evidently been leading
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me.  I went warily as I approached it, for fear the party might have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: halted to rest.  If they hadn't halted, I had no fear of being
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered, for I had seen that the Galus marched without point,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flankers or rear guard; and when I reached the pass and saw a narrow,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one-man trail leading upward at a stiff angle, I wished that I were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chief of the Galus for a few weeks.  A dozen men could hold off forever
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in that narrow pass all the hordes which might be brought up from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south; yet there it lay entirely unguarded.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Galus might be a great people in Caspak; but they were pitifully
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inefficient in even the simpler forms of military tactics.  I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surprised that even a man of the Stone Age should be so lacking in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: military perspicacity.  Du-seen dropped far below par in my estimation
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as I saw the slovenly formation of his troop as it passed through an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enemy country and entered the domain of the chief against whom he had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: risen in revolt; but Du-seen must have known Jor the chief and known
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that Jor would not be waiting for him at the pass.  Nevertheless he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took unwarranted chances.  With one squad of a home-guard company I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could have conquered Caspak.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs and I followed to the summit of the pass, and there we saw the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: party defiling into the Galu country, the level of which was not, on an
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: average, over fifty feet below the summit of the cliffs and about a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hundred and fifty feet above the adjacent Kro-lu domain.  Immediately
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the landscape changed.  The trees, the flowers and the shrubs were of a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hardier type, and I realized that at night the Galu blanket might be
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost a necessity.  Acacia and eucalyptus predominated among the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trees; yet there were ash and oak and even pine and fir and hemlock.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The tree-life was riotous.  The forests were dense and peopled by
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enormous trees.  From the summit of the cliff I could see forests
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rising hundreds of feet above the level upon which I stood, and even at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the distance they were from me I realized that the boles were of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gigantic size.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I had come to the Galu country.  Though not conceived in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, I had indeed come up cor-sva-jo--from the beginning I had come
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up through the hideous horrors of the lower Caspakian spheres of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evolution, and I could not but feel something of the elation and pride
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which had filled To-mar and So-al when they realized that the call had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come to them and they were about to rise from the estate of Band-lus to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that of Kro-lus.  I was glad that I was not batu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But where was Ajor?  Though my eyes searched the wide landscape before
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, I saw nothing other than the warriors of Du-seen and the beasts of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the fields and the forests.  Surrounded by forests, I could see wide
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plains dotting the country as far as the eye could reach; but nowhere
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a sign of a small Galu she--the beloved she whom I would have given
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my right hand to see.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs and I were hungry; we had not eaten since the preceding night, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: below us was game--deer, sheep, anything that a hungry hunter might
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crave; so down the steep trail we made our way, and then upon my belly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with Nobs crouching low behind me, I crawled toward a small herd of red
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deer feeding at the edge of a plain close beside a forest.  There was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ample cover, what with solitary trees and dotting bushes so that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found no difficulty in stalking up wind to within fifty feet of my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quarry--a large, sleek doe unaccompanied by a fawn.  Greatly then did I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: regret my rifle.  Never in my life had I shot an arrow, but I knew how
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was done, and fitting the shaft to my string, I aimed carefully and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: let drive.  At the same instant I called to Nobs and leaped to my feet.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The arrow caught the doe full in the side, and in the same moment Nobs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was after her.  She turned to flee with the two of us pursuing her,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs with his great fangs bared and I with my short spear poised for a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cast.  The balance of the herd sprang quickly away; but the hurt doe
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lagged, and in a moment Nobs was beside her and had leaped at her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: throat.  He had her down when I came up, and I finished her with my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spear.  It didn't take me long to have a fire going and a steak
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broiling, and while I was preparing for my own feast, Nobs was filling
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: himself with raw venison.  Never have I enjoyed a meal so heartily.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For two days I searched fruitlessly back and forth from the inland sea
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost to the barrier cliffs for some trace of Ajor, and always I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trended northward; but I saw no sign of any human being, not even the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: band of Galu warriors under Du-seen; and then I commenced to have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: misgivings.  Had Chal-az spoken the truth to me when he said that Ajor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had quit the village of the Kro-lu?  Might he not have been acting upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the orders of Al-tan, in whose savage bosom might have lurked some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: small spark of shame that he had attempted to do to death one who had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: befriended a Kro-lu warrior--a guest who had brought no harm upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kro-lu race--and thus have sent me out upon a fruitless mission in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope that the wild beasts would do what Al-tan hesitated to do?  I did
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not know; but the more I thought upon it, the more convinced I became
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that Ajor had not quitted the Kro-lu village; but if not, what had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought Du-seen forth without her?  There was a puzzler, and once again
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was all at sea.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the second day of my experience of the Galu country I came upon a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bunch of as magnificent horses as it has ever been my lot to see.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were dark bays with blazed faces and perfect surcingles of white about
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their barrels.  Their forelegs were white to the knees.  In height they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stood almost sixteen hands, the mares being a trifle smaller than the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stallions, of which there were three or four in this band of a hundred,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which comprised many colts and half-grown horses.  Their markings were
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost identical, indicating a purity of strain that might have
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: persisted since long ages ago.  If I had coveted one of the little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ponies of the Kro-lu country, imagine my state of mind when I came upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these magnificent creatures!  No sooner had I espied them than I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: determined to possess one of them; nor did it take me long to select a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beautiful young stallion--a four-year-old, I guessed him.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The horses were grazing close to the edge of the forest in which Nobs
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I were concealed, while the ground between us and them was dotted
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with clumps of flowering brush which offered perfect concealment.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stallion of my choice grazed with a filly and two yearlings a little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apart from the balance of the herd and nearest to the forest and to me.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At my whispered "Charge!"  Nobs flattened himself to the ground, and I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knew that he would not again move until I called him, unless danger
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threatened me from the rear.  Carefully I crept forward toward my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unsuspecting quarry, coming undetected to the concealment of a bush not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more than twenty feet from him.  Here I quietly arranged my noose,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spreading it flat and open upon the ground.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: To step to one side of the bush and throw directly from the ground,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which is the style I am best in, would take but an instant, and in that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instant the stallion would doubtless be under way at top speed in the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opposite direction.  Then he would have to wheel about when I surprised
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him, and in doing so, he would most certainly rise slightly upon his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hind feet and throw up his head, presenting a perfect target for my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noose as he pivoted.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Yes, I had it beautifully worked out, and I waited until he should turn
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in my direction.  At last it became evident that he was doing so, when
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparently without cause, the filly raised her head, neighed and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: started off at a trot in the opposite direction, immediately followed,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of course, by the colts and my stallion.  It looked for a moment as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though my last hope was blasted; but presently their fright, if fright
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was, passed, and they resumed grazing again a hundred yards farther
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on.  This time there was no bush within fifty feet of them, and I was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at a loss as to how to get within safe roping-distance.  Anywhere under
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forty feet I am an excellent roper, at fifty feet I am fair; but over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I knew it would be a matter of luck if I succeeded in getting my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noose about that beautiful arched neck.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I stood debating the question in my mind, I was almost upon the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: point of making the attempt at the long throw.  I had plenty of rope,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this Galu weapon being fully sixty feet long.  How I wished for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: collies from the ranch!  At a word they would have circled this little
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bunch and driven it straight down to me; and then it flashed into my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind that Nobs had run with those collies all one summer, that he had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gone down to the pasture with them after the cows every evening and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: done his part in driving them back to the milking-barn, and had done it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intelligently; but Nobs had never done the thing alone, and it had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a year since he had done it at all.  However, the chances were more in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: favor of my foozling the long throw than that Nobs would fall down in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his part if I gave him the chance.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Having come to a decision, I had to creep back to Nobs and get him, and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then with him at my heels return to a large bush near the four horses.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here we could see directly through the bush, and pointing the animals
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out to Nobs I whispered:  "Fetch 'em, boy!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In an instant he was gone, circling wide toward the rear of the quarry.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They caught sight of him almost immediately and broke into a trot away
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from him; but when they saw that he was apparently giving them a wide
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: berth they stopped again, though they stood watching him, with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: high-held heads and quivering nostrils.  It was a beautiful sight.  And
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: then Nobs turned in behind them and trotted slowly back toward me.  He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did not bark, nor come rushing down upon them, and when he had come
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closer to them, he proceeded at a walk.  The splendid creatures seemed
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more curious than fearful, making no effort to escape until Nobs was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite close to them; then they trotted slowly away, but at right angles.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And now the fun and trouble commenced.  Nobs, of course, attempted to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turn them, and he seemed to have selected the stallion to work upon,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for he paid no attention to the others, having intelligence enough to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: know that a lone dog could run his legs off before he could round up
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: four horses that didn't wish to be rounded up.  The stallion, however,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had notions of his own about being headed, and the result was as pretty
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a race as one would care to see.  Gad, how that horse could run!  He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed to flatten out and shoot through the air with the very minimum
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of exertion, and at his forefoot ran Nobs, doing his best to turn him.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was barking now, and twice he leaped high against the stallion's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flank; but this cost too much effort and always lost him ground, as
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: each time he was hurled heels over head by the impact; yet before they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared over a rise in the ground I was sure that Nobs' persistence
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was bearing fruit; it seemed to me that the horse was giving way a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trifle to the right.  Nobs was between him and the main herd, to which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the yearling and filly had already fled.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I stood waiting for Nobs' return, I could not but speculate upon my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chances should I be attacked by some formidable beast.  I was some
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distance from the forest and armed with weapons in the use of which I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was quite untrained, though I had practiced some with the spear since
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaving the Kro-lu country.  I must admit that my thoughts were not
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pleasant ones, verging almost upon cowardice, until I chanced to think
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of little Ajor alone in this same land and armed only with a knife!  I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was immediately filled with shame; but in thinking the matter over
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: since, I have come to the conclusion that my state of mind was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: influenced largely by my approximate nakedness.  If you have never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wandered about in broad daylight garbed in a bit of red-deer skin in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inadequate length, you can have no conception of the sensation of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: futility that overwhelms one.  Clothes, to a man accustomed to wearing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clothes, impart a certain self-confidence; lack of them induces panic.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But no beast attacked me, though I saw several menacing forms passing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through the dark aisles of the forest.  At last I commenced to worry
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over Nobs' protracted absence and to fear that something had befallen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him.  I was coiling my rope to start out in search of him, when I saw
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the stallion leap into view at almost the same spot behind which he had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared, and at his heels ran Nobs.  Neither was running so fast or
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: furiously as when last I had seen them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The horse, as he approached me, I could see was laboring hard; yet he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kept gamely to his task, and Nobs, too.  The splendid fellow was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: driving the quarry straight toward me.  I crouched behind my bush and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laid my noose in readiness to throw.  As the two approached my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hiding-place, Nobs reduced his speed, and the stallion, evidently only
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: too glad of the respite, dropped into a trot.  It was at this gait that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he passed me; my rope-hand flew forward; the honda, well down, held the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noose open, and the beautiful bay fairly ran his head into it.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Instantly he wheeled to dash off at right angles.  I braced myself with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the rope around my hip and brought him to a sudden stand.  Rearing and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: struggling, he fought for his liberty while Nobs, panting and with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lolling tongue, came and threw himself down near me.  He seemed to know
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that his work was done and that he had earned his rest.  The stallion
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was pretty well spent, and after a few minutes of struggling he stood
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with feet far spread, nostrils dilated and eyes wide, watching me as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: edged toward him, taking in the slack of the rope as I advanced.  A
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dozen times he reared and tried to break away; but always I spoke
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: soothingly to him and after an hour of effort I succeeded in reaching
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his head and stroking his muzzle.  Then I gathered a handful of grass
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and offered it to him, and always I talked to him in a quiet and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reassuring voice.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had expected a battle royal; but on the contrary I found his taming a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: matter of comparative ease.  Though wild, he was gentle to a degree,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and of such remarkable intelligence that he soon discovered that I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
