text: no intention of harming him.  After that, all was easy.  Before that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day was done, I had taught him to lead and to stand while I stroked his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: head and flanks, and to eat from my hand, and had the satisfaction of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seeing the light of fear die in his large, intelligent eyes.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The following day I fashioned a hackamore from a piece which I cut from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the end of my long Galu rope, and then I mounted him fully prepared for
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a struggle of titanic proportions in which I was none too sure that he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would not come off victor; but he never made the slightest effort to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unseat me, and from then on his education was rapid.  No horse ever
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learned more quickly the meaning of the rein and the pressure of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knees.  I think he soon learned to love me, and I know that I loved
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him; while he and Nobs were the best of pals.  I called him Ace.  I had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a friend who was once in the French flying-corps, and when Ace let
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: himself out, he certainly flew.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I cannot explain to you, nor can you understand, unless you too are a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horseman, the exhilarating feeling of well-being which pervaded me from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the moment that I commenced riding Ace.  I was a new man, imbued with a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sense of superiority that led me to feel that I could go forth and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conquer all Caspak single-handed.  Now, when I needed meat, I ran it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down on Ace and roped it, and when some great beast with which we could
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not cope threatened us, we galloped away to safety; but for the most
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: part the creatures we met looked upon us in terror, for Ace and I in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: combination presented a new and unusual beast beyond their experience
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ken.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For five days I rode back and forth across the southern end of the Galu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country without seeing a human being; yet all the time I was working
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slowly toward the north, for I had determined to comb the territory
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thoroughly in search of Ajor; but on the fifth day as I emerged from a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forest, I saw some distance ahead of me a single small figure pursued
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by many others.  Instantly I recognized the quarry as Ajor.  The entire
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: party was fully a mile away from me, and they were crossing my path at
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right angles, Ajor a few hundred yards in advance of those who
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: followed her.  One of her pursuers was far in advance of the others,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and was gaining upon her rapidly.  With a word and a pressure of the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knees I sent Ace leaping out into the open, and with Nobs running close
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alongside, we raced toward her.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first none of them saw us; but as we neared Ajor, the pack behind
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the foremost pursuer discovered us and set up such a howl as I never
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before have heard.  They were all Galus, and I soon recognized the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foremost as Du-seen.  He was almost upon Ajor now, and with a sense of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terror such as I had never before experienced, I saw that he ran with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his knife in his hand, and that his intention was to slay rather than
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: capture.  I could not understand it, but I could only urge Ace to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greater speed, and most nobly did the wondrous creature respond to my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: demands.  If ever a four-footed creature approximated flying, it was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ace that day.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Du-seen, intent upon his brutal design, had as yet not noticed us.  He
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was within a pace of Ajor when Ace and I dashed between them, and I,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaning down to the left, swept my little barbarian into the hollow of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an arm and up on the withers of my glorious Ace.  We had snatched her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the very clutches of Du-seen, who halted, mystified and raging.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ajor, too, was mystified, as we had come up from diagonally behind her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so that she had no idea that we were near until she was swung to Ace's
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back.  The little savage turned with drawn knife to stab me, thinking
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I was some new enemy, when her eyes found my face and she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recognized me.  With a little sob she threw her arms about my neck,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gasping:  "My Tom!  My Tom!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then Ace sank suddenly into thick mud to his belly, and Ajor and I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were thrown far over his head.  He had run into one of those numerous
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: springs which cover Caspak.  Sometimes they are little lakes, again but
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tiny pools, and often mere quagmires of mud, as was this one overgrown
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with lush grasses which effectually hid its treacherous identity.  It
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is a wonder that Ace did not break a leg, so fast he was going when he
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell; but he didn't, though with four good legs he was unable to wallow
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from the mire.  Ajor and I had sprawled face down in the covering
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grasses and so had not sunk deeply; but when we tried to rise, we found
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that there was not footing, and presently we saw that Du-seen and his
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: followers were coming down upon us.  There was no escape.  It was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evident that we were doomed.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Slay me!" begged Ajor.  "Let me die at thy loved hands rather than
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beneath the knife of this hateful thing, for he will kill me.  He has
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sworn to kill me.  Last night he captured me, and when later he would
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have his way with me, I struck him with my fists and with my knife I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stabbed him, and then I escaped, leaving him raging in pain and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thwarted desire.  Today they searched for me and found me; and as I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fled, Du-seen ran after me crying that he would slay me.  Kill me, my
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tom, and then fall upon thine own spear, for they will kill you
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horribly if they take you alive."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I couldn't kill her--not at least until the last moment; and I told her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so, and that I loved her, and that until death came, I would live and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fight for her.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs had followed us into the bog and had done fairly well at first,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but when he neared us he too sank to his belly and could only flounder
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about.  We were in this predicament when Du-seen and his followers
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: approached the edge of the horrible swamp.  I saw that Al-tan was with
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him and many other Kro-lu warriors.  The alliance against Jor the chief
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had, therefore, been consummated, and this horde was already marching
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the Galu city.  I sighed as I thought how close I had been to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saving not only Ajor but her father and his people from defeat and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Beyond the swamp was a dense wood.  Could we have reached this, we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would have been safe; but it might as well have been a hundred miles
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away as a hundred yards across that hidden lake of sticky mud.  Upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the edge of the swamp Du-seen and his horde halted to revile us.  They
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could not reach us with their hands; but at a command from Du-seen they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fitted arrows to their bows, and I saw that the end had come.  Ajor
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: huddled close to me, and I took her in my arms.  "I love you, Tom," she
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: said, "only you."  Tears came to my eyes then, not tears of self-pity
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for my predicament, but tears from a heart filled with a great love--a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heart that sees the sun of its life and its love setting even as it
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rises.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The renegade Galus and their Kro-lu allies stood waiting for the word
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from Du-seen that would launch that barbed avalanche of death upon us,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when there broke from the wood beyond the swamp the sweetest music that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever fell upon the ears of man--the sharp staccato of at least two
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: score rifles fired rapidly at will.  Down went the Galu and Kro-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warriors like tenpins before that deadly fusillade.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What could it mean?  To me it meant but one thing, and that was that
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Hollis and Short and the others had scaled the cliffs and made their
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way north to the Galu country upon the opposite side of the island in
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time to save Ajor and me from almost certain death.  I didn't have to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have an introduction to them to know that the men who held those rifles
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were the men of my own party; and when, a few minutes later, they came
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forth from their concealment, my eyes verified my hopes.  There they
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were, every man-jack of them; and with them were a thousand straight,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sleek warriors of the Galu race; and ahead of the others came two men
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the garb of Galus.  Each was tall and straight and wonderfully
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muscled; yet they differed as Ace might differ from a perfect specimen
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of another species.  As they approached the mire, Ajor held forth her
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms and cried, "Jor, my chief!  My father!" and the elder of the two
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rushed in knee-deep to rescue her, and then the other came close and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked into my face, and his eyes went wide, and mine too, and I cried:
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Bowen!  For heaven's sake, Bowen Tyler!"
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was he.  My search was ended.  Around me were all my company and the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man we had searched a new world to find.  They cut saplings from the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forest and laid a road into the swamp before they could get us all out,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then we marched back to the city of Jor the Galu chief, and there
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was great rejoicing when Ajor came home again mounted upon the glossy
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back of the stallion Ace.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tyler and Hollis and Short and all the rest of us Americans nearly
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: worked our jaws loose on the march back to the village, and for days
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: afterward we kept it up. They told me how they had crossed the barrier
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs in five days, working twenty-four hours a day in three
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eight-hour shifts with two reliefs to each shift alternating
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: half-hourly.  Two men with electric drills driven from the dynamos
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aboard the _Toreador_ drilled two holes four feet apart in the face of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff and in the same horizontal planes.  The holes slanted
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slightly downward.  Into these holes the iron rods brought as a part of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our equipment and for just this purpose were inserted, extending about
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a foot beyond the face of the rock, across these two rods a plank was
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laid, and then the next shift, mounting to the new level, bored two
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more holes five feet above the new platform, and so on.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: During the nights the searchlights from the _Toreador_ were kept playing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the cliff at the point where the drills were working, and at the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rate of ten feet an hour the summit was reached upon the fifth day.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ropes were lowered, blocks lashed to trees at the top, and crude
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: elevators rigged, so that by the night of the fifth day the entire
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: party, with the exception of the few men needed to man the _Toreador_,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were within Caspak with an abundance of arms, ammunition and equipment.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From then on, they fought their way north in search of me, after a vain
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and perilous effort to enter the hideous reptile-infested country to
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the south.  Owing to the number of guns among them, they had not lost a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man; but their path was strewn with the dead creatures they had been
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forced to slay to win their way to the north end of the island, where
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they had found Bowen and his bride among the Galus of Jor.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The reunion between Bowen and Nobs was marked by a frantic display upon
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs' part, which almost stripped Bowen of the scanty attire that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu custom had vouchsafed him.  When we arrived at the Galu city, Lys
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: La Rue was waiting to welcome us.  She was Mrs. Tyler now, as the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: master of the _Toreador_ had married them the very day that the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: search-party had found them, though neither Lys nor Bowen would admit
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that any civil or religious ceremony could have rendered more sacred
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bonds with which God had united them.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Neither Bowen nor the party from the _Toreador_ had seen any sign of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley and his party.  They had been so long lost now that any hopes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for them must be definitely abandoned.  The Galus had heard rumors of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them, as had the Western Kro-lu and Band-lu; but none had seen aught of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them since they had left Fort Dinosaur months since.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We rested in Jor's village for a fortnight while we prepared for the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: southward journey to the point where the _Toreador_ was to lie off shore
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in wait for us.  During these two weeks Chal-az came up from the Kro-lu
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country, now a full-fledged Galu.  He told us that the remnants of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Al-tan's party had been slain when they attempted to re-enter Kro-lu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chal-az had been made chief, and when he rose, had left the tribe under
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a new leader whom all respected.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs stuck close to Bowen; but Ace and Ajor and I went out upon many
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long rides through the beautiful north Galu country.  Chal-az had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought my arms and ammunition up from Kro-lu with him; but my clothes
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were gone; nor did I miss them once I became accustomed to the free
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attire of the Galu.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last came the time for our departure; upon the following morning we
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were to set out toward the south and the _Toreador_ and dear old
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: California.  I had asked Ajor to go with us; but Jor her father had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: refused to listen to the suggestion.  No pleas could swerve him from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his decision:  Ajor, the cos-ata-lo, from whom might spring a new and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greater Caspakian race, could not be spared.  I might have any other
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she among the Galus; but Ajor--no!
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The poor child was heartbroken; and as for me, I was slowly realizing
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hold that Ajor had upon my heart and wondered how I should get
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: along without her.  As I held her in my arms that last night, I tried
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to imagine what life would be like without her, for at last there had
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: come to me the realization that I loved her--loved my little barbarian;
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and as I finally tore myself away and went to my own hut to snatch a
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: few hours' sleep before we set off upon our long journey on the morrow,
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I consoled myself with the thought that time would heal the wound and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that back in my native land I should find a mate who would be all and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more to me than little Ajor could ever be--a woman of my own race and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my own culture.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Morning came more quickly than I could have wished.  I rose and
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breakfasted, but saw nothing of Ajor.  It was best, I thought, that I
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: go thus without the harrowing pangs of a last farewell.  The party
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: formed for the march, an escort of Galu warriors ready to accompany us.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I could not even bear to go to Ace's corral and bid him farewell.  The
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: night before, I had given him to Ajor, and now in my mind the two
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seemed inseparable.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And so we marched away, down the street flanked with its stone houses
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and out through the wide gateway in the stone wall which surrounds the
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: city and on across the clearing toward the forest through which we must
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pass to reach the northern boundary of Galu, beyond which we would turn
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south.  At the edge of the forest I cast a backward glance at the city
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which held my heart, and beside the massive gateway I saw that which
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought me to a sudden halt.  It was a little figure leaning against
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of the great upright posts upon which the gates swing--a crumpled
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little figure; and even at this distance I could see its shoulders
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heave to the sobs that racked it.  It was the last straw.
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bowen was near me.  "Good-bye old man," I said.  "I'm going back."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He looked at me in surprise.  "Good-bye, old man," he said, and grasped
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my hand.  "I thought you'd do it in the end."
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then I went back and took Ajor in my arms and kissed the tears from
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her eyes and a smile to her lips while together we watched the last of
title: The People That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Americans disappear into the forest.
